StringTable.Label: AgendaVictoryConditionDef_DefeatRandomAIPlayer_Desc
StringTable.String: Defeat a random AI player who starts in a different sector.

StringTable.Label: AgendaVictoryConditionDef_ClaimRelics_Desc
StringTable.String: Claim the majority of the Precursor Relics.

StringTable.Label: AgendaVictoryConditionDef_ClaimPrecursorWorlds_Desc
StringTable.String: Claim the majority of the Precursor Worlds.

StringTable.Label: ALERT_OtherBuiltGalacticAchievement
StringTable.String: We've heard rumors that the %s have built the %s Galactic Achievement.

StringTable.Label: ALERT_OtherPutStarbaseInTerritory
StringTable.String: %s has built a starbase in our territory.

StringTable.Label: ALERT_OtherWithdrewFromUP
StringTable.String: %s has withdrawn from the United Planets.

StringTable.Label: ALERT_UPResolutionExpired
StringTable.String: The %s United Planets Resolution has expired.

StringTable.Label: ALERT_OtherResearchedVictoryTech
StringTable.String: %s has researched %s in preparation for a tech victory.

StringTable.Label: ALERT_OtherGotMajorityAscensionCrystals
StringTable.String: %s has captured the majority of ascension crystals and can seek ascension victory.

StringTable.Label: ALERT_OtherReachedAscensionPoints
StringTable.String: %s has gathered enough aura points to win an ascension victory.

StringTable.Label: ALERT_AgreementExpired
StringTable.String: One of your agreements with %s has expired.

StringTable.Label: ALERT_AgreementCancelled
StringTable.String: %s has cancelled an agreement with you.

StringTable.Label: ALERT_ShipyardCannotManufactureShip
StringTable.String: %s is no longer repeatedly manufacturing %s because you have run out of %s.

StringTable.Label: ALERT_GalacticEventActive_Duration
StringTable.String: The galactic event %s is active for %ld more turns.

StringTable.Label: AllianceAscendant_CampaignDec
StringTable.String: The year is 2307. It has been decades since the Terran Alliance and their coalition were able to liberate the known universe from the evil Drengin Empire and their thralls.[BR][BR]The galaxy finds itself at peace (other than the continuing proliferation of Hyperdrive, which is allowing some of the aggressive "minor civilizations" to join the galactic stage.)[BR][BR]Today finds DL Bradley in charge of the Leathon system and its neighboring stars. Rumors are that a new civilization, the Xeloxi, is attacking freighters and extorting civilians into paying protection money. If these rumors are true, then something must be done...

StringTable.Label: Campaign_AllianceAscendant_OwnThreeMinorRaces_Dec
StringTable.String: Minor Civilizations have a single homeworld that will provide benefits when within a civilization's zone of control. Settle worlds and build starbases to extend your Zone of Control till there are 3 Minor Civilizations under your protection.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_AllianceAscendant_DestroyXeloxi_Dec
StringTable.String: The Xeloxi have been extorting and pillaging these systems long enough. Remove the Xeloxi from the sector by taking all their planets. You can use diplomacy to buy yourself time to build up a strong fleet, but conflict is inevitable.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_AllianceAscendant_EnsureMinorFactionsSurvive_Dec
StringTable.String: The Civilizations in this region of space have suffered enough. They've only recently achieved space-faring status and have been subjugated by immoral dealings since then. We must treat and protect them fairly to provide a true sense of security and gain their trust.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_Campaign_AllianceAscendant_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: It's been decades since the last galactic conflict. The known systems have been more or less at peace. There's been a shift, though; there are reports that a new civilization is conducting less than legitimate business. Rumor is that the Xeloxi, previously unknown, are responsible. The Terran Alliance must intervene, bring stability to the system, and deal with this Xeloxi group.[BR][BR]Minor Civilizations have been hurt the most, so a priority should be bringing them under Alliance influence. Once they're secure and the Xeloxi's stream of ill-gotten resources is cut off, the Xeloxi can be dealt with.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_Campaign_AllianceAscendant_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: When provided stability and protection, Minor Civilizations serve as a source of resources. Settling near and keeping them under Alliance influence will give a distinct advantage over the unscrupulous Xeloxi.

StringTable.Label: Terran_AllianceAscendant_System_Dec
StringTable.String: The Leathon system has a class 28 planet perfect for a human colony, making it the ideal location to establish a base.

StringTable.Label: Artifacts_DESC
StringTable.String: Artifacts are powerful relics of lost civilizations. They are rare, but give valuable rewards.

StringTable.Label: ArtifactAnomaly_Dec
StringTable.String: We discovered an artifact in space and collected it with our survey ship.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_FinishProjectArtifact_Dec
StringTable.String: A scan of this Precursor artifact doesn't reveal anything unusual, but when that scan is backed up to the nearest colonial database, strange things start happening. The physical structure of the artifact itself is a form of self-executing code, which seizes control of the colonial computer, and soon after the manufacturing sector. Thousands of tiny worker bots are produced which almost immediately complete the project currently in progress on the world. They then immediately shut down.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_FinishTechArtifact_Dec
StringTable.String: This is a sentient [HS=HS_ArtifactResearchCharge]Precursor Archive[/HS]. When our survey team member attempts to interface with it he claims to have boundless knowledge and shows all the signs of a remarkable and sudden increase in intelligence. Over the next several minutes, he details astounding technological breakthroughs until his head explodes.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_GetTerraformer_Dec
StringTable.String: This capsule of [HS=HS_ArtifactPlanetClass]Chimeric Biomass[/HS] was fired into space in the hopes it would find a new world to revitalize. While it never found its original target, we can now repurpose it to improve the ecosystem of any world we choose.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_GetDimensionalSnare_Dec
StringTable.String: A strange device here has trapped a creature from another dimension. We can collect the [HS=HS_ArtifactCagedMonster]Dimensional Snare[/HS] and release the creature in an area of our choosing. Hard to say what the effects of that will be. Don't bet a lot of money on the creature being grateful to us, however.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_GetActivatedNanites_Dec
StringTable.String: We've discovered a container filled with specialized Nanites capable of examining the structure of whatever material they are exposed to, determining its original design via an encyclopedic knowledge of engineering principles and semantic cues, and then rebuilding it back to like-new condition. The end result is we can use these [HS=HS_ArtifactFleetRepair]Mnemonic Nanites[/HS] to instantly repair any of our fleets.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_GetBoostCoil_Dec
StringTable.String: We've discovered a high energy fuel source. Although it won't last long, it is enough to get a substantial increase in output from any ship's engine. We can use this [HS=HS_ArtifactFleetResetMoves]Boost Coil[/HS] to reset the moves of any of our fleets.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_GetBetatronCollider_Dec
StringTable.String: We've discovered a massive mine, with the markings of Precursor technology. We're fortunate it didn't trigger by our approach, though perhaps it was smart enough to detect we weren't a threat. We should be able to collect it and adapt its key component, a [HS=HS_ArtifactFleetDamage]Betatron Collider[/HS], into a device that can inflict heavy damage on an enemy fleet.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_GetBernalSphere_Dec
StringTable.String: This cargo module is a self contained habitat, complete with a synthetic workforce, idle for now but otherwise in perfect condition. We can use this [HS=HS_ArtifactPlanetPopulation]Bernal Sphere[/HS] to add a citizen to any of our worlds.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_GetClimatePurifier_Dec
StringTable.String: This artifact was intended as part of a larger terraforming project that would convert a dead world into a paradise. Unfortunately only the first stage is working, a [HS=HS_ArtifactPlanetPollution]Climate Purifier[/HS] that will remove the most caustic elements from the planet's atmosphere.

StringTable.Label: Capsules_DESC
StringTable.String: Capsules are lost goods never recovered, escape pods, jettisoned contraband, or simply misplaced wares. They have miscellaneous effects.

StringTable.Label: ContrabandTech_Dec
StringTable.String: We discovered a mysterious capsule floating in space. After scanning it, we brought it onboard our ship.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostAndFound_Dec
StringTable.String: The scorched and pitted exterior of this abandoned cargo pod gives the impression that its rightful owners are unlikely to return for it in this life. It would be a shame to let the goods inside go to waste.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostCargo_Dec
StringTable.String: The capsule contains military equipment, which is not normally found in civilian containers such as this. It seems likely it was dropped by smugglers before an inspection. Their loss is our gain, but we'll have to decide how to best make use of it.

StringTable.Label: Quest_MysteriousHardware_Dec
StringTable.String: The alien computational systems found in this capsule are so advanced that our survey team lack the vocabulary to describe all but their most rudimentary functions. But even those low-level capabilities would be enough to advance our technological studies by leaps and bounds.

StringTable.Label: Quest_DistressBeacon_Dec
StringTable.String: We've discovered a beacon sending a distress call for an emergency that happened millennia ago. Grave threat, galaxy's only hope, please, anyone, something something. Though we are perhaps a little late to respond to the emergency itself, the broadcast equipment in the beacon can certainly be put to use.

StringTable.Label: Quest_Credits_Dec
StringTable.String: The scorched and pitted exterior of this abandoned cargo pod gives the impression that its rightful owners are unlikely to return for it in this life. It would be a shame to let the goods inside go to waste.

StringTable.Label: Quest_HeliosOre_Dec
StringTable.String: The scorched and pitted exterior of this abandoned cargo pod gives the impression that its rightful owners are unlikely to return for it in this life. It would be a shame to let the goods inside go to waste.

StringTable.Label: Quest_Durantium_Dec
StringTable.String: The capsule contains military equipment, which is not normally found in civilian containers such as this. It seems likely it was dropped by smugglers before an inspection. Their loss is our gain, but we'll have to decide how to best make use of it.

StringTable.Label: Quest_Promethion_Dec
StringTable.String: The capsule contains military equipment, which is not normally found in civilian containers such as this. It seems likely it was dropped by smugglers before an inspection. Their loss is our gain, but we'll have to decide how to best make use of it.

StringTable.Label: ShipGraveyards_DESC
StringTable.String: Ship graveyards are the remains of less fortunate interstellar travelers. They spawn assorted ship-related rewards.

StringTable.Label: GraveyardAnomoly_Dec
StringTable.String: We explored the remains of an ancient stellar battle.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_LostScoutAnomoly_Dec
StringTable.String: A small vessel drifts in deep space, all systems dead. Upon examination it appears to be an old scout from some long forgotten war. Its capabilities do not strain even the moderate intellects crewing our survey ship, and with a little work they believe it could be restored to service.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_LostSurveyAnomoly_Dec
StringTable.String: This survey ship is similar to Terran vessels, but our crew can't find an exact match anywhere in the database. The exterior shows signs of wormhole passage, but is otherwise in good shape. The interior however, needs substantial cleanup to deal with a mysterious green goo. There's no sign of the occupants, unless they're the green goo, which.... they might be actually. Still. Free ship.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_LostCutterAnomoly_Dec
StringTable.String: Our survey crew finds a scorched but salvageable vessel amid the wreckage of a forgotten skirmish that appears to have occurred during the Dread Lord war. The bodies of the crew are found within, apparently executed. By their opponents, or perhaps their peers, it's hard to say - the Dread Lords cruelty was infamous. In any event, there are few obstacles preventing our crew from repairing the ship and pressing it into service.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_LostDefenderAnomoly_Dec
StringTable.String: A single ship orbits the remains of a planet destroyed by the terrible weaponry of the Dread Lord war. The crew, long dead, stand their posts - waiting for reinforcements that never came.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_LostGunboatAnomoly_Dec
StringTable.String: We've discovered an enormous Drengin battlecruiser floating in deep space, its hull perforated by thousands of small kinetic impacts. It is wholly unsalvageable. A Terran gunboat drifting nearby, however, is still in working order. The pilot's mummified remains still have their hands on the cannon controls, a smile frozen forever on their face.

StringTable.Label: Anomaly_LostConstructorAnomoly_Dec
StringTable.String: Here lie the remains of a starbase, destroyed beyond any hope of salvage. Nearby however lies an abandoned constructor, never given a chance to fulfill its function. Minimal repairs will be needed to get it working again, to the point it can create a starbase of our own.

StringTable.Label: SpaceJunk_DESC
StringTable.String: These make up the flotsam and jetsam of the galaxy. They are of rarely of great value, but provide unique opportunities.

StringTable.Label: BigCredits_Dec
StringTable.String: We discovered the remains of some sort of vessel. Our survey ship sets to the work of searching the debris for anything of value.

StringTable.Label: Wormholes_DESC
StringTable.String: Wormholes are also rare, they simply transport any ship that enters them to a random location in the Galaxy.

StringTable.Label: WormholeAnomaly_Dec
StringTable.String: Your survey ship is caught in an unknown field and sucked through a hole in space itself. The crew may be annoyed at the unplanned detour, but the fact that they are somehow unharmed after traveling such a vast distance in the blink of an eye should keep morale at an acceptable level.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorAnomaly_DESC
StringTable.String: This anomaly is a rare and powerful treasure, for anyone that can deal with its powerful guardians.

StringTable.Label: PrecursorProductionAnomaly_Dec
StringTable.String: Our survey ship discovered precursor debris. Unfortunately, others discovered it first.

StringTable.Label: Event_Derelict_Dec_0X1F2BD
StringTable.String: Your flagship has discovered a derelict ship drifting in space. It appears to contain an artifact with the power to repair a fleet anywhere in the galaxy. What do you want to do with it?

StringTable.Label: Event_Derelict_Authority_Bonus_Dec_0X1F2BD
StringTable.String: Acquire the ability to repair a fleet anywhere in the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Event_Derelict_Calm_Bonus_Name_0X1F2BD
StringTable.String: Extract the raw materials from it.

StringTable.Label: Event_Derelict_Calm_Bonus_Dec_0X1F2BD
StringTable.String: +500 Credits and +2 Elerium to your faction.

StringTable.Label: Event_Specter_Grasp_Dec_0X1F3CD
StringTable.String: Awaiting our ship in the silent void is the Specter's Grasp, an enigmatic artifact radiating a knowledge-imbuing energy.

StringTable.Label: Event_Specter_Grasp_Traditional_Bonus_Dec_0X1F3CD
StringTable.String: This artifact appears to give vast insights when used allowing us to gain a lot of research knowledge at once.

StringTable.Label: Event_Specter_Grasp_Nihilism_Bonus_Name_0X1F3CD
StringTable.String: Extract maximum power from the artifact, regardless of potential risks.

StringTable.Label: Event_Specter_Grasp_Nihilism_Bonus_Dec_0X1F3CD
StringTable.String: The technology behind this device is beyond us. It will permanently alter the DNA of our people to make them a little smarter but a little more reckless.

StringTable.Label: Event_AncientWormhole_Dec_0X1F4CD
StringTable.String: Our exploration has led us to an artifact of Precursor origin, a device once capable of bending the fabric of spacetime to instantly relocate their vessels to chosen coordinates. Regrettably, the ravages of time have not been kind. The artifact's pinpoint precision has faded into erratic uncertainty - our researchers warn that activation will now result in a random spatial displacement. Nevertheless, this unpredictable characteristic could be tactically advantageous, providing us a means to displace unwelcome fleets into the vast, unknown reaches of space.

StringTable.Label: Event_AncientWormhole_Modification_Bonus_Name_0X1F4CD
StringTable.String: Attempt to deconstruct the artifact into its original components.

StringTable.Label: Event_AncientWormhole_Bonus_Effect_0X1F4CD
StringTable.String: The valuable elements that make up the artifact will provide us with some instant credits.

StringTable.Label: Event_SpaceMonsterCage_Name_0X1F5CD
StringTable.String: The Elusive Beast in a Cage

StringTable.Label: Event_SpaceMonsterCage_Dec_0X1F5CD
StringTable.String: Our flagship has come across a drifting artifact that houses a monstrous entity of unknown origin. Will we dare to use it as a tool of destruction, or harness its potential to further our knowledge?

StringTable.Label: Event_SpaceMonsterCage_Bonus_Dec_0X1F5CD
StringTable.String: We place the snare into our artifact vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_SpaceMonsterCage_Bonus_Effect_0X1F5CD
StringTable.String: It probably won't feel too much pain. But it is a sacrifice we are willing to make for us to get some valuable research.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundFoodReplicator_0x5F3C_Name
StringTable.String: A Surprise in Space: The Precursor Food Replicator

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundFoodReplicator_0x5F3C_Dec
StringTable.String: Our ship has stumbled upon a lost cargo container adrift in the vastness of space. After some time deciphering the ancient glyphs on the exterior, we've identified the contents - a Precursor Food Replicator. This device of incredible tech can synthesize food from nearly anything, greatly increasing the range of any ship equipped with it. Fancy an endless supply of alien space wafers?

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundFoodReplicator_0x5F3C_Choice1_Name
StringTable.String: Integrate this into our starship culinary department.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundFoodReplicator_0x5F3C_Choice1_Dec
StringTable.String: This component will be available in our vault ready to be added to a starship, significantly extending their travel range. Plus, the crew will be happier thanks to the endless supplies of nutrient wafers!

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundFoodReplicator_0x5F3C_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Sell it on the galactic market for credits.

StringTable.Label: Quest_GuiltMagnifier_0x5F3D_Dec
StringTable.String: As our ship glides through the silent vacuum of space, it stumbles upon a lost cargo container. Opening the container reveals an extraordinary device capable of amplifying guilty feelings. Our psychological analysts speculate that installing this 'Guilt Magnifier' on a Core world could drastically reduce crime rates. We might have just found the galactic equivalent of a conscience!

StringTable.Label: Quest_GuiltMagnifier_0x5F3D_Choice1_Name
StringTable.String: Store this in the vault for later deployment.

StringTable.Label: Quest_GuiltMagnifier_0x5F3D_Choice1_Dec
StringTable.String: This device will be added to the vault for later use.

StringTable.Label: Quest_GuiltMagnifier_0x5F3D_Choice2_Name
StringTable.String: Break down the device and extract the precious Durantium inside.

StringTable.Label: Quest_GuiltMagnifier_0x5F3D_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Sell the Guilt Magnifier on the Galactic Market for some credits.

StringTable.Label: Quest_WeaponJammer_0x6A4C_Dec
StringTable.String: We've encountered a derelict cargo container drifting in the dark vastness of space. The container isn't the interesting part, it's what is inside: A Weapon Targeting Jammer! This device could be installed on one of our ships to increase its ability to evade enemy weapons.

StringTable.Label: Quest_WeaponJammer_0x6A4C_Choice1_Name
StringTable.String: Add the Weapon Jammer to our vault.

StringTable.Label: Quest_WeaponJammer_0x6A4C_Choice1_Dec
StringTable.String: This will be available in our vault to be added to a ship.

StringTable.Label: Quest_WeaponJammer_0x6A4C_Choice2_Name
StringTable.String: Extract the Thulium. We need that more.

StringTable.Label: Quest_DerelictMiningDrone_Dec
StringTable.String: Our flagship finds a derelict mining drone, drifting aimlessly in space. The drone appears to be from an advanced civilization and is still functional. Your engineers manage to reprogram and repair the drone. Upon confirmation, the drone is added your fleet, providing increased mining capabilities and efficiency for resource gathering.

StringTable.Label: Quest_DerelictMiningDrone_Pragmatism_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Reprogram the drone to enhance general resource gathering capabilities.

StringTable.Label: Quest_DerelictMiningDrone_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Reprogram the drone to focus on gathering Durantium.

StringTable.Label: Quest_CelestialArtExhibition_Desc
StringTable.String: Our flagship encounters an awe-inspiring celestial phenomenon that seems to be a form of cosmic art created by an unknown species. The vivid display of colors and patterns has a profound impact on the crew and sparks a wave of creativity throughout the civilization. Upon confirmation, your civilization gains a one-time culture boost, which could help with diplomacy and influence.

StringTable.Label: Quest_CelestialArtExhibition_Pragmatism_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Embrace the cosmic inspiration giving our worlds additional influence.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AbandonedResearchOutpost_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship has discovered an abandoned research outpost in deep space. The outpost appears to have been deserted for quite some time, but the advanced technology inside is still in working condition.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AbandonedResearchOutpost_Investigate_Name
StringTable.String: Investigate the outpost and retrieve the valuable scientific data.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ArtifactJoyOrResource_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship discovers an ancient artifact, a mysterious object imbued with immense power. This artifact can either be harnessed to provide a massive energy spike for our Shipyards or used to generate an aura of euphoria on a target planet, uplifting the mood of its inhabitants and providing a temporary boost to productivity.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ArtifactJoyOrResource_Pragmatism_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Channel the artifact's energy to temporarily enhance manufacturing on our worlds.

StringTable.Label: Quest_ArtifactJoyOrResource_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Secure the artifact in the vault for later use.

StringTable.Label: Quest_PrecursorArtifactCache_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship locates a hidden cache of Precursor artifacts, left behind by the ancient civilization. These artifacts are not only valuable but also hold clues to the advanced technologies of the Precursors.

StringTable.Label: Quest_PrecursorArtifactCache_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Add the artifact into the vault.

StringTable.Label: Quest_MysteriousEnergySource_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship detects an unusual energy signature coming from a nearby asteroid. Upon investigation, the crew finds a stable and potent energy source that can be harnessed to enhanced the manufacturing of our planets.

StringTable.Label: Quest_MysteriousEnergySource_Pragmatism_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Utilize the energy source to temporarily increase manufacturing on our worlds.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostCargoContainer_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship comes across a drifting cargo container, seemingly abandoned and adrift in space for years. The container is filled with valuable trade goods and rare resources.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostCargoContainer_Pragmatism_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Acquire the valuable goods to boost your economy for many months.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AncientStarMap_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship discovers an ancient star map etched into the surface of a seemingly insignificant moon. The map reveals that there is a very valuable relatively close to our current location.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AncientStarMap_Pragmatism_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Seek out the high quality planet in a nearby star system.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AutomatedRepairStation_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship encounters an automated repair station left behind by a long-lost civilization. Despite its age, the station is still operational and capable of repairing and upgrading ships.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AutomatedRepairStation_Pragmatism_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Receive free repairs and a one-time upgrade to your starship's weapons, defenses, or engines, improving its combat or exploration capabilities.

StringTable.Label: Quest_EnigmaticMonolith_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship discovers an enigmatic monolith floating in space, emitting a mysterious energy that seems to resonate with the crew's thoughts. Studying the monolith provides a temporary boost to the crew's problem-solving abilities.

StringTable.Label: Quest_EnigmaticMonolith_Pragmatism_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Gain a a one-time burst of knowledge.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostExplorersLog_Dec
StringTable.String: Our flagship finds the remains of a long-lost explorer's vessel, along with a detailed log of their discoveries. This log contains invaluable information on various planets, anomalies, and points of interest throughout the galaxy. Upon confirmation, your civilization finds a previously unknown world available to be settled on.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostExplorersLog_Pragmatism_Name
StringTable.String: Use the log to chart new paths.

StringTable.Label: Quest_WreckageOfTheTitan_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship discovers that the artifact contains a key that summons the remains of a massive battlecruiser, the Titan, once the flagship of an ancient and powerful armada. While too ancient to use directly, our scientists are quick to track down potentially useful knowledge from it.

StringTable.Label: Quest_WreckageOfTheTitan_Equality_Name
StringTable.String: Salvage and recruit a mercenary ship.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AncientArtifact_Dec
StringTable.String: During the thorough analysis of the artifact, your research team has unearthed an astonishing discovery - it is a reservoir of colossal energy. The scientists in your crew are confident that they can channel this raw power to propel our civilization forward. Yet, a dissenting perspective suggests that this energy could be utilized as a cosmic key, opening up uncharted dimensions of the cosmos, and revealing secrets of space hitherto unknown.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AncientArtifact_Choice_1
StringTable.String: Harvest the artifact's energy and gain a valuable resource.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AncientArtifact_Choice_2_0x43b
StringTable.String: Store the artifact in the vault.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AncientArtifact2_Dec
StringTable.String: Your fleet stumbles upon an ancient artifact floating in the depths of space. Its origin is unknown. It is made of the strange metal our scientists call Durantium. The purpose of this artifact is lost to time but we can still make use of its raw materials.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AncientArtifact2_Choice_1
StringTable.String: Harvest the artifact's power and gain a valuable resource.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AncientArtifact2_Choice_2
StringTable.String: Use the artifact's power to create a new world for all to share.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AncientArtifact3_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship arrives at the strange artifact. What it once did can only be known to the ancient Precursors. However, within the depths of it is a container holding valuable Antimatter. Your crew carefully remove the Antimatter and put it into storage for later use.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AncientArtifact3_Choice_1
StringTable.String: Extract the energy from the artifact and convert it into valuable Antimatter for our use.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AncientArtifact3_Choice_2
StringTable.String: Release the ancient civilization, known as The Ecliptae, from the artifact and allow them to live among the stars once again.

StringTable.Label: Event_SpaceMonsterCage_Desc_0X1F4DE
StringTable.String: Our ship has stumbled upon a peculiar artifact adrift in the cold void of space. It appears to be a cage, but not for any ordinary creature. This containment unit was designed for something... monstrous. We have two clear options: keep the artifact and possibly unleash the beast at a strategic moment, or study the cage's advanced technology, risking the inadvertent release of the captive creature.

StringTable.Label: Event_SpaceMonsterCage_Keep_Name_0X1F4DE
StringTable.String: Keep the artifact. This monster might serve a purpose.

StringTable.Label: Event_SpaceMonsterCage_Keep_Desc_0X1F4DE
StringTable.String: Take the cage into our possession, ready to release the monster when needed.

StringTable.Label: Event_SpaceMonsterCage_Experiment_Name_0X1F4DE
StringTable.String: Study the cage's technology. We can deal with the monster.

StringTable.Label: Event_SpaceMonsterCage_Experiment_Desc_0X1F4DE
StringTable.String: Dissect the artifact for its advanced technology, advancing our own scientific knowledge in the current research topic. This may haunt us later.

StringTable.Label: Event_ArnorIntegrityDevice_Desc_0X1F5C3
StringTable.String: An intriguing discovery has been made - a device from the long-gone Arnor civilization. Its structure suggests it might be used to enhance the structural integrity of our fleet. Alternatively, its exotic materials could fetch a good price on the interstellar market.

StringTable.Label: Event_ArnorIntegrityDevice_Bonus_Desc_0X1F5C3
StringTable.String: Add the artifact to our vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_ArnorIntegrityDevice_Disassemble_Effect_Desc_0X1F5C3
StringTable.String: Disassemble the artifact and sell the resulting materials on the market for a substantial amount of credits.

StringTable.Label: Event_PrecursorTerraformer_Desc_0X1F4E0
StringTable.String: Our flagship has discovered an artifact of the ancient Precursors. It appears to be a device of terraforming capabilities, seemingly able to upgrade a planet's class by an entire level. We could store it for future use or dismantle it to obtain valuable resources.

StringTable.Label: Event_PrecursorTerraformer_Bonus_Desc_0X1F4E0
StringTable.String: Store the artifact in our vault for potential future terraforming purposes.

StringTable.Label: Event_PrecursorTerraformer_Disassemble_Effect_Desc_0X1F4E0
StringTable.String: Dismantle the artifact and sell the extracted resources on the interstellar market.

StringTable.Label: Event_DreadLordWeapon_Desc_0X1F5E0
StringTable.String: Our flagship has discovered an artifact, suspected to be of Dread Lord origin. It's a weapon of terrifying power, able to instantly damage an entire enemy fleet. We must decide whether to preserve it for potential usage or dismantle it for valuable resources.

StringTable.Label: Event_DreadLordWeapon_Bonus_Desc_0X1F5E0
StringTable.String: Keep the artifact in our vault, harnessing its potential to damage enemy fleets when needed.

StringTable.Label: Event_DreadLordWeapon_Disassemble_Effect_Desc_0X1F5E0
StringTable.String: Disassemble the weapon and sell the obtained resources on the galactic market.

StringTable.Label: Event_ArnorLifeDevice_Desc_0X1F6FB
StringTable.String: Our flagship has stumbled upon an artifact of the ancient Arnor civilization. It is a device with the stunning capability to transform lifeless worlds into habitable ones. Should we preserve it or harvest it for parts?

StringTable.Label: Event_ArnorLifeDevice_Bonus_Desc_0X1F6FB
StringTable.String: Take the artifact. Store it in our vaults. We may find a world worthy of its power.

StringTable.Label: Event_ArnorLifeDevice_Disassemble_Effect_Desc_0X1F6FB
StringTable.String: Break down the artifact and sell its components. Let's profit from this ancient technology.

StringTable.Label: Event_NaniteWarship_Desc_0X1F7AC
StringTable.String: Our flagship has discovered an artifact from an unknown, long-gone civilization. Inside, we found sophisticated Nanites capable of assembling a powerful, automated warship. Do we harness this power, or do we disassemble it for profit?

StringTable.Label: Event_NaniteWarship_Bonus_Desc_0X1F7AC
StringTable.String: Preserve the artifact. The potential of commanding an ancient warship could shift the balance of power in our favor.

StringTable.Label: Event_NaniteWarship_Disassemble_Effect_Desc_0X1F7AC
StringTable.String: Disassemble the artifact and sell its Nanite components. Such advanced technology could fetch a high price on the interstellar market.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundCargoContainer_Name_0x4A2B
StringTable.String: A lost but now found Survey Module

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundCargoContainer_Dec_0x4A2B
StringTable.String: Our flagship has stumbled upon a lost cargo container drifting through space. It's marked with several unfamiliar alien symbols and we suspect it might contain some valuable contents. Inside, we find a survey module, one of the rarest items we know of. Survey modules are what make a flagship a "Flagship" in that they contain a vast array of specialized tools and sensors for dealing with the anomalies that litter the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundCargoContainer_Choice1_Dec_0x4A2B
StringTable.String: This component will be available at our shipyard when we design a new survey ship.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundCargoContainer_Choice2_Name_0x4A2B
StringTable.String: Mine it for resources, who knows what's inside.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundCargoContainer_Choice3_Name_0x4A2B
StringTable.String: Sell the whole mystery box. Let someone else deal with it.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundCargoContainer_0x4A2C_Dec
StringTable.String: Our flagship has stumbled across a curious sight. A drifting Precursor cargo container. An intense sense of excitement fills the bridge as we approach. Initial scans indicate the container houses an advanced particle beam that is remarkably small even if not particularly powerful. The component is filled with a high concentration of Promethium.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundCargoContainer_0x4A2C_Choice1_Name
StringTable.String: Send the component to our shipyards.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundCargoContainer_0x4A2C_Choice1_Dec
StringTable.String: This component will be available for our next flagship design. The engineers are already brimming with ideas.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundCargoContainer_0x4A2C_Choice2_Name
StringTable.String: Extract the Promethium. We could always use more resources.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FoundCargoContainer_0x4A2C_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Sell the lot on the Galactic Market. In hard credits we trust!

StringTable.Label: Quest_RareArtifact_0x9F8D_Dec
StringTable.String: Our flagship has detected an ancient cargo container, drifting aimlessly in the void. This appears to be a relic from the Precursor Wars! Inside we find a fully intact Arnorian Drive system, a ship component that is remarkably small for its size. It could be attached to a ship to increase its speed. Alternatively, we could harvest a significant quantity of Thulium from it or sell it to the highest bidder. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Quest_RareArtifact_0x9F8D_Choice1_Name
StringTable.String: Send the Precursor drive back home.

StringTable.Label: Quest_RareArtifact_0x9F8D_Choice1_Dec
StringTable.String: This drive will be available when we design a new ship.

StringTable.Label: Quest_RareArtifact_0x9F8D_Choice2_Dec
StringTable.String: Gain 2 Thulium for use in various advanced technologies.

StringTable.Label: Quest_RareArtifact_0x9F8D_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Sell the artifact on the Galactic Market.

StringTable.Label: Quest_RareArtifact_0x9F8D_Choice3_Dec
StringTable.String: Earn 600 credits from interested buyers across the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AbandonedSlipstreamAccelerator_0x5F2C_Dec
StringTable.String: While cruising through the void, your ship picks up an unexpected signal - a lost cargo container floating aimlessly. Upon closer inspection, it contains a Slipstream Accelerator, an essential component for FTL travel! It's like finding a Ferrari engine at a yard sale.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AbandonedSlipstreamAccelerator_0x5F2C_Choice1_Name
StringTable.String: Awesome. We can use this on one of our fleets.

StringTable.Label: AbandonedSlipstreamAccelerator_0x5F2C_Choice1_Dec
StringTable.String: Put this in our Artifact Vault to be used on one of our fleets later.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AbandonedSlipstreamAccelerator_0x5F2C_Choice2_Name
StringTable.String: Let's dismantle it for some precious Elerium.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AbandonedSlipstreamAccelerator_0x5F2C_Choice2_Dec
StringTable.String: Elerium is a rare and valuable resource. It might not be as exciting as a Slipstream Accelerator but Elerium is pretty nice too.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AbandonedSlipstreamAccelerator_0x5F2C_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Sell it for a good sum of credits.

StringTable.Label: Quest_AbandonedSlipstreamAccelerator_0x5F2C_Choice3_Dec
StringTable.String: It's an old saying that one man's space trash is another man's space treasure.

StringTable.Label: Event_SurveyModule_Dec_0X2D5E
StringTable.String: Your ship has stumbled upon a cargo hold lost in the vastness of space. It contains an advanced Survey Module, possibly from an ancient civilization. This module could be used to give an existing ship the ability to investigate anomalies. Alternatively, it can be broken down into valuable antimatter or sold for credits.

StringTable.Label: Event_SurveyModule_Store_Name_0X2D5E
StringTable.String: Store the survey module in our vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_SurveyModule_Store_Desc_0X2D5E
StringTable.String: We will be able to make an existing ship able to survey anomalies.

StringTable.Label: Event_SurveyModule_BreakDown_Name_0X2D5E
StringTable.String: Break down the survey module for its components.

StringTable.Label: Event_SurveyModule_Sell_Name_0X2D5E
StringTable.String: Sell the survey module for credits.

StringTable.Label: Event_SurveyModule_Sell_Desc_0X2D5E
StringTable.String: Convert the survey module into a substantial amount of credits.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostEnergyWeapon_0x5C2B_Desc
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports the discovery of a lost cargo container floating in space. Upon inspection, a mysterious energy weapon is found inside. The weapon appears to be of unknown origin and technology, with the potential to be a powerful asset.

StringTable.Label: Event_EnergyWeapon_Store_Name_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: Store the energy weapon in the vault for future use.

StringTable.Label: Event_EnergyWeapon_Store_Desc_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: You decide to store the energy weapon in your vault for future use. This mysterious device could prove to be a game-changer in your civilization's defense or offense strategies. Or not. In either event you can install it on one of your ships and find out.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostEnergyWeapon_0x5C2B_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Sell the energy weapon for credits.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostMissileWeapon_0x5C2A_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports the discovery of a lost cargo container floating in space. Upon inspection, it contains an advanced missile weapon prototype. The device is unlike anything seen before, and its origin remains a mystery. It could be used to add missile weapons to one of our ships.

StringTable.Label: Event_MissileWeapon_Store_Name_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: Store the missile weapon in our vault for later use.

StringTable.Label: Event_MissileWeapon_Store_Desc_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: Keep the advanced missile weapon prototype in our vault allowing it to be installed on a ship later.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostMissileWeapon_0x5C2A_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Sell the missile weapon for credits.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostKineticWeapon_0x5C2B_Desc
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports the discovery of a mysterious cargo container floating in space. Upon inspection, it contains an advanced kinetic weapon of unknown origin. It is some sort of self-replicating mass-driver. It could be a valuable addition to your arsenal or sold for credits.

StringTable.Label: Event_KineticWeapon_Store_Name_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: Store the weapon in our vault for later use.

StringTable.Label: Event_KineticWeapon_Store_Desc_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: You decide to keep the weapon, storing it in your vault for future use. Its advanced technology may help one of your ships survive a battle.

StringTable.Label: Quest_TacticalThrusterUpgrade_0x5E3C_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports the discovery of a drifting cargo container in deep space. Upon inspection, it contains a highly advanced tactical thruster upgrade device, seemingly lost by another civilization. This thruster could be added to one of our ships making it be able to get into firing range faster, a possibly critical advantage.

StringTable.Label: Event_TacticalThrusterUpgrade_Store_Name_0X3F7A
StringTable.String: Store the device in the vault for later use.

StringTable.Label: Event_TacticalThrusterUpgrade_Store_Desc_0X3F7A
StringTable.String: You decide to secure the newly discovered tactical thruster upgrade device in your vault, for future research and potential implementation into your fleet. This could provide a significant advantage over your adversaries in future conflicts.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostEngineUpgradeModule_0x5C2B_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship's captain reports the discovery of a lost cargo container floating in space. Upon investigation, it appears to contain a rare and valuable engine upgrade module that can increase a ship's speed through Hyperspace. The captain awaits your orders on how to proceed with this discovery.

StringTable.Label: Event_EngineUpgradeModule_Store_Name_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: Store the module in our vault for future use.

StringTable.Label: Event_EngineUpgradeModule_Store_Desc_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: Bring the engine upgrade module back to our civilization's vault for safekeeping and potential future use. Add to one of your ships to increase its speed.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostPollutionRemoverModule_0x4C2B_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports the discovery of a mysterious cargo container floating in the void. Upon inspection, it contains an advanced Pollution Remover Module of unknown origin. It filters out the pollutants in the atmosphere. The deciphered writing is from the container indicates that it was 'too expensive' and was being returned. This device could be a valuable asset in maintaining planetary ecosystems or sold for a tidy profit.

StringTable.Label: Event_PollutionRemoverModule_Store_Name_0X2E6F
StringTable.String: Store the module in the vault for later use.

StringTable.Label: Event_PollutionRemoverModule_Store_Desc_0X2E6F
StringTable.String: Secure the Pollution Remover Module in your vault, allowing it to be used on one of our various despoiled worlds. You, obviously being the despoiler in this scenario. This device could help give the illusion you care about the ecosystems of our worlds.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostArmorModule_0x7C3D_Desc
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports the discovery of a lost cargo container drifting in space. Inside, they found a mysterious and advanced armor module that can be applied to a starship. It seems to be of great value, but its true potential is yet to be unlocked.

StringTable.Label: Event_ArmorModule_Store_Name_0X5A7F
StringTable.String: Store the Armor Module in our vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_ArmorModule_Store_Desc_0X5A7F
StringTable.String: Store the armor module in your vault and keep it for future use. Its potential may prove invaluable in future engagements, providing increased protection to a target ship.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostPlanetaryBroadcaster_0x4C2B_Desc
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports the discovery of a lost cargo container floating in space. Upon further inspection, it appears to contain an ancient, yet functional Planetary Broadcaster device. The device is intended to send out a one-time burst of entertainment related information across a wide area. If it were used on a planet, it would greatly increase the planet's influence.

StringTable.Label: Event_PlanetaryBroadcaster_Store_Name_0X2E6F
StringTable.String: Store the Planetary Broadcaster in the vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_PlanetaryBroadcaster_Store_Desc_0X2E6F
StringTable.String: Deciding to keep the device, you store the planetary broadcaster in your vault for future use. Apply it to a planet that is struggling against foreign influence for best results.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostPlanetaryBroadcaster_0x4C2B_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Sell the Planetary Broadcaster for credits.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostPlanetaryCultureModule_0x4C2B_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports the discovery of a mysterious cargo container floating in space. Upon opening it, the crew finds an ancient device that upon study appears to have a vast catalog of the cultural significance of every planet in the galaxy. This is a remarkable treasure. Unfortunately, the device is obviously very old and likely only able to be used once. It could be used to uncover the cultural value of any planet we choose.

StringTable.Label: Event_PlanetaryCultureModule_Store_Name_0X2E6F
StringTable.String: Store the Planetary Culture Module for later use.

StringTable.Label: Event_PlanetaryCultureModule_Store_Desc_0X2E6F
StringTable.String: Deciding to keep the Planetary Culture Module for your civilization, you store it in your vault. Its potential to shape the cultural identity of entire planets could prove to be a valuable asset in your future endeavors. It will increase the base cultural significance of the planet you choose.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostPlanetaryCultureModule_0x4C2B_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Dissemble the module and sell the components for money.

StringTable.Label: Quest_PlanetaryDefenseModule_0x8F3C_Desc
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports discovering a lost cargo container adrift in space. Upon inspection, the container houses an advanced Planetary Defense Module, believed to be from a long-forgotten civilization. This mysterious device could prove invaluable to your empire by increasing a given planet's defense capabilities against invasion.

StringTable.Label: Event_PlanetaryDefenseModule_Store_Name_0X4E7A
StringTable.String: Store the defense module in the vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_PlanetaryDefenseModule_Store_Desc_0X4E7A
StringTable.String: Storing this Planetary Defense Module in your vault could provide invaluable protection to your empire's planets in times of conflict. Its advanced technology could potentially prevent a planet for being invaded.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostEnemyDestablizerModule_0x4C2B_Desc
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports the discovery of a lost cargo container floating in space. This device appears to be able to be quietly slipped into orbit of an enemy planet raising that planet's crime rate. A very devious device indeed.

StringTable.Label: Event_EnemyDestablizerModule_Store_Desc_0X2E6F
StringTable.String: Choose to store the Enemy Destabilizer Module in your vault. Crime is bad except when it's happening to people you don't like. This device will increase the crime rate of any planet you choose.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostEnemyDefenseSabotageModule_0x4C1B_Dec
StringTable.String: While exploring the far reaches of space, your flagship stumbles upon a mysterious cargo container. Upon opening it, they discover a highly advanced enemy defense sabotage module. This device permanently reduces an enemy planet's ability to defend against invasion by installing trillions of tiny, self-replicating crystalline orbs that damage the planet's air-based defense systems.

StringTable.Label: Event_EnemyDefenseSabotageModule_Store_Name_0X2D6F
StringTable.String: Store the module in the vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_EnemyDefenseSabotageModule_Store_Desc_0X2D6F
StringTable.String: Deciding that the module could prove useful in future invasions, you order your crew to store it securely in the vault.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostEnemyDefenseSabotageModule_0x4C1B_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Sell the module for credits (after taking it apart)

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostPropagandizeModule_0x5C2A_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports finding a lost cargo container adrift in space. Upon opening, they discover a sophisticated Propagandize Module capable of swaying enemy citizens' loyalty. The net effect is that it greatly reduces the enemy planet's cultural significance. Will you keep it for future use or sell it for credits?

StringTable.Label: Event_PropagandizeModule_Store_Desc_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: By keeping the Propagandize Module in your vault, you can use it later to reduce the influence of a target planet.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostPropagandizeModule_0x5C2A_Choice2_Name
StringTable.String: Take it apart and sell the pieces for money.

StringTable.Label: Quest_PoisonEnemyPlanetModule_0x4C2B_Desc
StringTable.String: Your captain reports discovering a lost cargo container in the depths of space. Inside, they found a highly advanced device capable of poisoning an enemy planet's environment. What should be done with this dangerous technology?

StringTable.Label: Event_PoisonEnemyPlanetModule_Store_Name_0X2E6F
StringTable.String: Store the device in our vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_PoisonEnemyPlanetModule_Store_Desc_0X2E6F
StringTable.String: The device is carefully stored in your civilization's vault, where it remains available for potential future use.

StringTable.Label: Quest_PoisonEnemyPlanetModule_0x4C2B_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Take it apart and sell the pieces for money.

StringTable.Label: Quest_PoisonEnemyPlanetModule_0x4C2B_Choice3_Desc
StringTable.String: Instead of keeping the device, you decide to sell it on the galactic market for a hefty. The buyer remains anonymous, and the device's ultimate destination is unknown. Nonetheless, your civilization's coffers are now filled with valuable currency.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostDepleteResourcesModule_0x5C2B_Dec
StringTable.String: As your flagship approaches an abandoned cargo container, it detects an advanced Deplete Resources Module within. This mysterious device has the power to sap the resources of enemy planets. Will you keep this powerful tool or sell it for credits?

StringTable.Label: Event_DepleteResourcesModule_Store_Name_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: Store the Deplete Resources Module in the Vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_DepleteResourcesModule_Store_Desc_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: By storing the Deplete Resources Module in your vault, you gain the ability to use its power in the future. This device can be deployed to drain resources from enemy planets, giving you a strategic advantage in conflicts.

StringTable.Label: Quest_LostDepleteResourcesModule_0x5C2B_Choice3_Name
StringTable.String: Sell the Deplete Resources components for money.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FriendlyPlanetMineralScanner_0x5C2B_Dec
StringTable.String: Your captain reports finding a lost cargo container adrift in space. Inside, they discovered an advanced mineral scanner, a device capable of accurately detecting valuable resources on distant planets. It can only be used once but it could still be very valuable. This cutting-edge technology could provide a significant advantage.

StringTable.Label: Event_FriendlyPlanetMineralScanner_Store_Name_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: Store the Mineral Scanner in our vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_FriendlyPlanetMineralScanner_Store_Desc_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: By storing the advanced mineral scanner in your vault, you can utilize its technology to improve resource detection on our planets.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FriendlyPlanetMineralScanner_0x5C2B_Choice2_Name
StringTable.String: Sell the Mineral Scanner for credits.

StringTable.Label: Quest_FriendlyPlanetTechFinderModule_0x5C2B_Name
StringTable.String: Lost Cargo: Friendly Planet Tech Finder

StringTable.Label: Quest_FriendlyPlanetTechFinderModule_0x5C2B_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports encountering a lost cargo container floating in space. After careful examination, it appears to be a device made by a long-lost civilization to find Precursor technology on planets. The device is very old and in poor shape, but it could still be valuable even if it can only be used once. Do you wish to store this device in your vault or sell it for credits?

StringTable.Label: Event_FriendlyPlanetTechFinderModule_Store_Name_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: Store the device in the vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_FriendlyPlanetTechFinderModule_Store_Desc_0X3E6F
StringTable.String: This device will increase the base Tech rating of a target planet.

StringTable.Label: Quest_SummonLeaderModule_0x4C2B_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports the discovery of a lost cargo container, floating through the void of space. As your crew investigates, they find a peculiar device inside, emitting a faint yet mesmerizing glow. With a bit of effort, your team realizes that it is an ancient Precursor device for summoning a prototype Yor advisor.

StringTable.Label: Event_SummonLeaderModule_Store_Name_0X2E6F
StringTable.String: Store the device in the vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_SummonLeaderModule_Store_Desc_0X2E6F
StringTable.String: By using this device you will summon an Ancient (but loyal) Yor as a leader you can assign.

StringTable.Label: Quest_RoboticServantsModule_0x5C2F_Dec
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports the discovery of a lost cargo container floating in space. Upon opening it, they find an advanced Robotic Servants Module - a device capable of significantly improving the efficiency of a planet's workforce. The choice is yours: store it for future use or sell it for credits?

StringTable.Label: Event_RoboticServantsModule_Store_Desc_0X3E7F
StringTable.String: By storing the Robotic Servants Module in your vault, you can deploy it on one of your planets at a later time, significantly improving workforce efficiency and productivity.

StringTable.Label: Quest_RoboticStarDrone_0x5C3D_Name
StringTable.String: Encounter with a Robotic Star Drone

StringTable.Label: Quest_RoboticStarDrone_0x5C3D_Desc
StringTable.String: Your flagship captain reports discovering a lost cargo container floating in the void. Upon opening, they reveal a mysterious robotic star drone with advanced technological capabilities. When this drone is deployed, it acts as a small but lethal ship in battle. This could prove useful or profitable.

StringTable.Label: Event_RoboticStarDrone_Store_Name_0X3F7C
StringTable.String: Store the drone in our vault.

StringTable.Label: Event_RoboticStarDrone_Store_Desc_0X3F7C
StringTable.String: By storing the drone, you can analyze its advanced technology and integrate it into your fleet, potentially boosting your fleet's capabilities in future engagements.

StringTable.Label: PillageTheWeak_Dec
StringTable.String: Send our Gatherers through the population to take what is needed for the empire from those too weak to resist.

StringTable.Label: BattleTactic_Balanced_Description
StringTable.String: No bonus, penalties, or change in battle length.

StringTable.Label: BattleTactic_Assault_Description
StringTable.String: -25% Defense, and your ships get a speed boost to rush in. The battle lasts 50% longer. Ships don't try to stay in formation while attacking.

StringTable.Label: BattleTactic_DefensiveFire_Description
StringTable.String: -50% Attack, +50% Defense. Useful when attempting to minimize damage to your fleet.

StringTable.Label: BattleTactic_Retreat_Description
StringTable.String: Fleet doesn't attack at all; the battle only lasts half as long.

StringTable.Label: BattleTactic_NoComingBack_Description
StringTable.String: Ships close to the death in an attempt to suicidally crash into enemy vessels.

StringTable.Label: BattleTactic_Capture_Description
StringTable.String: Has a chance to scavenge a ship if you defeat the other fleet.

StringTable.Label: BattleTactic_Skirmish_Description
StringTable.String: Ships attack until near death; then attempt to flee the battle.

StringTable.Label: BattleTactic_StandFirm_Description
StringTable.String: Ships hold their position and gain +50% weapon range.

StringTable.Label: BattleTactic_Surround_Description
StringTable.String: -25% Defense. Attacking ships are arranged around the defending fleet, preventing escape. The battle lasts twice as long.

StringTable.Label: BattleTactic_Swarm_Description
StringTable.String: Ships don't try to stay in formation while attacking.

StringTable.Label: Event_Pods_Dec
StringTable.String: Our scouts report that significant portions of {PLANETNAME} are inhabited by sentient pod-like creatures. These pods bond with other sentient life. Those who are bonded by these pods experience heightened intelligence but also display an alarming lack of morality. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Pods_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Excellent! Require our colonists to be 'introduced' to these pods.

StringTable.Label: Event_Pods_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Destroy the pods, we don't want to risk the health of our colony.

StringTable.Label: Event_Pods_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Keep our people away from those things. No one should have to live in agony.

StringTable.Label: Event_FragileCrust_Dec
StringTable.String: There is a disgusting amount of organic life crawling across the surface of {PLANETNAME}. It is a place of rot and refuse unsuited for our perfect forms. A massive fault line runs across the planet's crust. Our advisors suggest that a few well placed detonations could clear out this organic waste and expose more of the planet's wealth for collection. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_FragileCrust_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: No, don't fracture the world. Instead convert it for our use.

StringTable.Label: Event_FragileCrust_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Do not harm the planet, all life is sacred.

StringTable.Label: Event_CausticVapors_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} has vast reserves of trapped underground gasses. They occasionally erupt and cover city sized areas in grey ash. The vapors are heavy enough that they push all of the oxygen out of the affected region and kill most organic life. Fortunately the vapors have little effect on us and seem a reasonable precaution against the proliferation of organic life. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_CausticVapors_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Place our colony near one of the vapor geysers.

StringTable.Label: Event_CausticVapors_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Puncture the largest geysers and flood the world with the vapors.

StringTable.Label: Event_CausticVapors_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Cap the vapor geysers so that the world can better sustain organic life.

StringTable.Label: Event_SentientPlanet_Dec
StringTable.String: A small group of aliens you initially mistake for a copse of trees lives here. They claim they can speak with {PLANETNAME}. They offer to show you how. Although the planet seems disinterested in your day to day affairs, it might be possible to communicate with it further. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_SentientPlanet_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Begin communicating with the planet, ask it how to best live in harmony with it.

StringTable.Label: Event_SentientPlanet_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Invite the aliens to join your colony.

StringTable.Label: Event_SentientPlanet_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Threaten the planet with deep core mining unless it reveals its secrets.

StringTable.Label: Event_Earthquakes_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} is tectonically active, with regular earthquakes and volcanic eruptions. On the plus side, this is bringing a lot of valuable minerals up the surface, where it will be far easier to extract. On the downside, a lot of people are being killed by lava. Your engineers think they can stabilize the crust to stop the earthquakes, but the decision on whether to implement it hasn't been made yet. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Earthquakes_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We can't risk the safety of our people. Stabilize the crust.

StringTable.Label: Event_Earthquakes_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Move people to the most secure structures. Then ramp up our mining efforts.

StringTable.Label: Event_Earthquakes_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: This colony is now a mining camp and everyone can just deal with it.

StringTable.Label: Event_Swamped_Dec
StringTable.String: Upon landing on {PLANETNAME}, you quickly realize that it has been inhabited before. Beneath the northern ice, explorers have found a ruined starship with an active Leaching Field module which will reduce the shield strength of enemy ships in battle. Your colonists believe they can extract the module, but the resulting melt will flood much of the arable land on the planet; the climate change will kill most of the unique native species. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Swamped_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Set land aside for the native species. Leave the ship buried, but study its technology.

StringTable.Label: Event_Swamped_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: There's too much life in the universe as it is and this module can help our military.

StringTable.Label: Event_Ruins_Dec
StringTable.String: The primitive species that occupies {PLANETNAME} was once far more technologically advanced, and accidentally ruined their civilization in some kind of nuclear war several hundred years ago. Ruined cities dot the planet except for one bunker with an active missile defense system. But the natives regard this bunker as sacred, and insist we stay away from it. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Ruins_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Respect the dead and declare the bunker off limits.

StringTable.Label: Event_Ruins_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Excavate the bunker and claim the missile defense system.

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlants_Dec
StringTable.String: There's substantial evidence that much of the plant life on {PLANETNAME} is communicating with each other via pheromones, and that it may in fact be sentient. Unfortunately for us, the most intelligent of the plants seem to prefer the most fertile ground, which we had earmarked for colonization. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlants_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Attempt to communicate with the plants.

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlants_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: If there's sentient life, we won't butcher it.

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlants_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We need to feed our colonists. Rip the plants out by the roots.

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlantsSuccess_Dec
StringTable.String: Our scientists have been able to communicate with the plants on {PLANETNAME}. We have learned much about plants that we can apply across our empire.

StringTable.Label: Event_SmartPlantsFail_Dec
StringTable.String: Our attempts to communicate with the plants on {PLANETNAME} somehow offended them. They withered in response, as did the areas they inhabited.

StringTable.Label: Event_Worms_Dec
StringTable.String: The location of our colony on {PLANETNAME} is apparently the prime hunting grounds for a species of massive, building-sized worms. This is by far the most fertile land on the planet, so we don't want to move if we don't have to. But on the other hand, massive building sized worms. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Worms_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Protect the mega-fauna, it will be a surprise for invaders.

StringTable.Label: Event_Worms_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: The worms may have been here first, but we have bigger guns. Wipe them out.

StringTable.Label: Event_StrangeFungus_Dec
StringTable.String: A strange fungus on {PLANETNAME} has begun infecting our colonists with an illness that is immune to our medicine. Although our doctors can treat the symptoms easily enough, they have no hope of finding a cure, and the risk of contagion is high. With this disease afflicting us, our colony will never see its full growth potential. Some argue that we should cull the diseased to protect the rest of the colony. Others, notably the diseased, argue against this. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_StrangeFungus_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Don't cull anyone. Even if we never find a cure, we won't become monsters.

StringTable.Label: Event_StrangeFungus_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Quarantine the people who have the disease and prevent them from reproducing.

StringTable.Label: Event_StrangeFungus_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Cull them. Our descendants will thank us for having the courage to do this.

StringTable.Label: Event_High-GAnimalRacing_Dec
StringTable.String: Colonists on {PLANETNAME} have taken to breeding and racing a local species of squat, four-legged animals. The harsh gravity of the world makes the races particularly gruelling, and footage of injured animals has caused animal rights activists around the galaxy to demand this barbaric practice be stopped. But it's become a big part of the local culture, and the colonists won't be happy if we end the races. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_High-GAnimalRacing_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We must, of course, stop anything which even suggests cruelty to other forms of life.

StringTable.Label: Event_High-GAnimalRacing_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Export the footage across our civilization so everyone can enjoy the races.

StringTable.Label: Event_High-GAnimalRacing_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Promote the man behind this. Exploiting the weak is the foundation of our empire.

StringTable.Label: Event_AlienCulturalTrash_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} was once the home of an alien civilization which disappeared a thousand years earlier. Although none of their technology is new, many of their entertainment products remain intact, and are of great interest to the colonists. Unfortunately almost all of these shows and programs are incredibly childish and puerile, featuring an unfortunate amount of jokes about orifices. The colony's workplaces are now filled with practical jokes that sap productivity. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_AlienCulturalTrash_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Leave them be. They're adults who can make their own decisions.

StringTable.Label: Event_AlienCulturalTrash_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Let's at least try distributing this trash on the open market.

StringTable.Label: Event_AlienCulturalTrash_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Ban the trash, then laughter for a time to teach everyone a lesson.

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives_Dec
StringTable.String: An aggressive species of sentient quadrupeds live in the forests and hills of {PLANETNAME}. They've resisted all attempts to communicate with them, and have relentlessly attacked your colony since you arrived. Although no actual threat to you militarily, they can harass and easily slaughter unguarded civilians. As is so often the case when the risk of slaughter is non-zero, morale amongst the colonists is low. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Isolate the land these creatures live on. We can share this world.

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Toughen up. Colonists have to be ready to face risks.

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Capture these creatures for our invasions.

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives2_Dec
StringTable.String: Our isolation of the native quadrupeds on {PLANETNAME} was unsuccessful. They somehow escaped confinement and attacked our colony. Those that survived will never forget the attack.

StringTable.Label: Event_AggressiveNatives2_Liberty_Bonus_Dec
StringTable.String: Citizens become Traumatized on this planet

StringTable.Label: Event_Haunted_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} colonists report a variety of strange disturbances: Doors which open and close on their own, strange lights in the night; a mysterious hole in the ground which screams. Your scientists seem to think the colony might be haunted. "Building on the ruins of a previously failed colony may have been a bad idea," they say. "Also, underneath that colony was another failed colony. Which was built on a graveyard." What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Haunted_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Warn the colonists and move the colony somewhere less haunted.

StringTable.Label: Event_Haunted_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Fix the doors, fix the lights, and put some boards over the hole that screams.

StringTable.Label: Event_Haunted_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: It is superstition. Hide all evidence of supernatural activity.

StringTable.Label: Event_PowerfulDrug_Dec
StringTable.String: The flowers of a specific plant on {PLANETNAME} are a powerful intoxicant. The drug provides an intense feeling of contentment to all those who consume it, although in a few cases people have been content to walk directly into powerful machinery. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_PowerfulDrug_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Put in railings and let people use the drug recreationally.

StringTable.Label: Event_PowerfulDrug_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Make the drug illegal, but begin research efforts to find market uses for it.

StringTable.Label: Event_PowerfulDrug_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Content workers are hard workers. Give them more of the drug.

StringTable.Label: Event_Comet_Dec
StringTable.String: A comet has reentered the solar system of {PLANETNAME} after a fifty year absence, throwing a primitive local species into a frenzy. They apparently worship this regularly returning visitor as a god. Your scientists report that this comet is at least partly artificial, a relic apparently left in the Oort cloud by an advanced species. There may be some salvage potential in it, provided of course that we're willing to kill a god to get it. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Comet_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Invite the religious to come to the planet and worship the god comet.

StringTable.Label: Event_Comet_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Trap the comet in secret. Invite scientists to the planet to investigate what we find.

StringTable.Label: Event_Comet_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Kill the god, take the eye, use it to encourage our military.

StringTable.Label: Event_Comet_Authority_Bonus_Dec
StringTable.String: Free Eye of the Unknown God ship upgrade

StringTable.Label: Event_Thunderstorms_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} suffers from heavy thunderstorm activity. This is affecting an ancient ruin, revealing it to be a powerful alien artifact capable of drawing and channeling the tremendous energy. Sometimes this energy is channeled into the bodies of anyone standing nearby, with predictably messy consequences. Studying these ruins could prove incredibly valuable, although also dangerous to anyone who has to do it. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_Thunderstorms_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Leave the ruins alone, they are protecting the world from the storms.

StringTable.Label: Event_Thunderstorms_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Invite scientists to the world to study the ruins, even if it might disrupt them.

StringTable.Label: Event_Thunderstorms_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Pull the technology out, no matter how many lives it costs.

StringTable.Label: Event_Thunderstorms_Authority_Bonus_Dec
StringTable.String: Free Beam Magnification Array ship upgrade

StringTable.Label: Event_SolarFlare_Dec
StringTable.String: An increased period of solar activity has caused a species of previously dormant insects to suddenly begin swarming, greatly limiting activity on {PLANETNAME}. Your scientists have developed a sonic screen which can kill the insects, but believe there may also be a way to expand the technology to rid the world of the swarm forever. What effects that will have on the ecosystem are as yet unknown. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_SolarFlare_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: If this technology kills en masse, then we won't use it.

StringTable.Label: Event_SolarFlare_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Abandon parts of the planet that the bugs inhabit.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobots_Dec
StringTable.String: {PLANETNAME} was once the home of a fairly advanced alien species that created some extremely long lasting sub-sentient AI systems. Something you've done has triggered these systems defensive protocols. Now anyone who ventures outside of the colony is at risk of attack from primitive robotic creatures. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobots_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Thin out the robots around the colony and feel a little guilty about it.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobots_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Some clever programming should make sure the robots serve us instead.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobots_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Make killing the robots a sport and invite others to play.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobotsSuccess_Dec
StringTable.String: Our scientists have been able to take control of the planet's robots on {PLANETNAME}. After that, it is a simple matter to program them to perform subsurface drilling on the planet to reach mineral deposits that were out of the reach of our colonists. And, if we ever need it, we can switch them back to attack mode.

StringTable.Label: Event_LeftoverRobotsFail_Dec
StringTable.String: Our attempt to hack into the robots on {PLANETNAME} fails. Instead it triggers the robots to go into an even more aggressive mode where they view us as their primary target. We are still able to maintain our colony on {PLANETNAME}, but if we are ever invaded the invaders will discover a robotic army eager to help them out.

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFish_Dec
StringTable.String: On {PLANETNAME} there is a species of fish which seems to possess a form of collective intelligence. The fish seem to become more intelligent the larger the group they're in. In the largest schools they can clearly communicate with us, and even seem to understand advanced concepts like space travel and where we're from. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFish_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Accommodate the fish. This is their home; we will be gracious guests.

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFish_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Terraform the lakes to make them an ideal biome for the fish to grow.

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFish_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Our colonists need food and fish are delicious.

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFishSuccess_Dec
StringTable.String: We increase the size of the lakes and provide food for the fish on {PLANETNAME}. Just as we hoped, their collective intelligence grew exponentially. We had just begun to learn from them when they disappear, ascending to a dimension beyond ours. Still we made great strides in the short time we were together.

StringTable.Label: Event_SwarmLikeFishFail_Dec
StringTable.String: We increase the size of the lakes and provide food for the fish on {PLANETNAME}. Just as we hoped, their collective intelligence grew exponentially. Unfortunately, with their increased intelligence they decide they don't like us very much, a sentiment many share.

StringTable.Label: Event_SuperShark_Dec
StringTable.String: The waters of {PLANETNAME} are patrolled by a monstrously large creature, filled with teeth and ill will. It seems to have taken a particular interest in your colony and has already killed many of your colonists with its aforementioned teeth and ill will. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_SuperShark_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: We have no right to endanger a species that has survived for centuries.

StringTable.Label: Event_SuperShark_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Kill the shark and mount the skeleton in my throne room.

StringTable.Label: Event_SuperShark_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Setup some island castaways and see what they do when the super shark arrives.

StringTable.Label: Event_AnimalstoTame_Dec
StringTable.String: The terrain of {PLANETNAME} has proven very challenging for our conventional ground vehicles. Some colonists have begun capturing and taming a local species of marsupial to use for hopping around between buildings and colonies. The animals are well suited for the work, and don't seem to be suffering, but there have been a few accidents. Animal rights activists across the galaxy are demanding the practice be banned. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_AnimalstoTame_Liberty_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: This is shockingly primitive. End the practice at once.

StringTable.Label: Event_AnimalstoTame_Equality_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Launch a campaign to convince your citizens the beasts are well treated.

StringTable.Label: Event_AnimalstoTame_Authority_Bonus_Name
StringTable.String: Not suffering? Then they aren't working hard enough.

StringTable.Label: Event_CollapsingIceBridge_Dec
StringTable.String: Two continents of {PLANETNAME} are joined by a massive ice bridge, which is beginning to collapse. A large Snuggler Colony makes their home on this bridge and are in danger of dying within the next year if they're not relocated. The ice bridge is remote however, and this won't come cheaply. What are your orders?

StringTable.Label: Event_CollapsingIceBridge_Liberty_Bonus_Name
