StringTable.Label: TerrorStarBaseModule_Dec
StringTable.String: Begin constructing the skeleton of the most terrible weapon in the universe. (One per sector)

StringTable.Label: TerrorStarBaseModule_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Begin constructing the skeleton of the most terrible weapon in the universe. (One per sector)

StringTable.Label: TerrorStarCommandModule_Dec
StringTable.String: The decision to destroy a solar system is not a light one, a command center will be needed to provide accurate information and facilitate swift execution of the weapon system.

StringTable.Label: TerrorStarCommandModule_ShortDec
StringTable.String: A command center will be needed to provide accurate information and facilitate swift execution of the weapon system.

StringTable.Label: TerrorStarStorageModule_Dec
StringTable.String: The energy requirements to fire a Terror Star are immense, we will need a way to safely store the energy.

StringTable.Label: TerrorStarStorageModule_ShortDec
StringTable.String: The energy requirements to fire a Terror Star are immense, we will need a way to safely store the energy.

StringTable.Label: TerrorStarPropulsionModule_Dec
StringTable.String: What good is a star destroying weapon if it cant escape the gravity of your home star?

StringTable.Label: TerrorStarPropulsionModule_ShortDec
StringTable.String: What good is a star destroying weapon if it cant escape the gravity of your home star?

StringTable.Label: TerrorStarDeathBeamModule_Dec
StringTable.String: Adds the finishing touch to the Terror Star - the devastating death beam!

StringTable.Label: TerrorStarDeathBeamModule_ShortDec
StringTable.String: Adds the finishing touch to the Terror Star - the devastating death beam!

StringTable.Label: SingleCluster_Description
StringTable.String: A small, single sector. Each player starts on an edge the sector.

StringTable.Label: MediumCluster_Description
StringTable.String: A large, single sector. Each player starts on an edge of the sector.

StringTable.Label: DoubleCluster_Description
StringTable.String: Two large sectors. Players will start on the borders of each sector.

StringTable.Label: Cross_Description
StringTable.String: A large central sector surrounded by four smaller sectors. Players begin in the center sector.

StringTable.Label: SolSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The Terran solar system containing a class 28 [HS=HS_TerrestrialWorld]Terrestrial[/HS] world and two small worlds.

StringTable.Label: DrengiSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The Drengin home system containing a class 29 [HS=HS_VolcanicWorld]Volcanic[/HS] world and 2 small worlds.

StringTable.Label: AltariaSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The Altarian home system containing a class 30 [HS=HS_TropicalWorld]Tropical[/HS] world and 1 small world.

StringTable.Label: IridiaSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The Iridium home system containing a class 29 [HS=HS_TerrestrialWorld]Terrestrial[/HS] world and a small world with high wealth.

StringTable.Label: IconiaSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The ancient Iconian, and now Yor, home system.[BR]It contains a class 29 [HS=HS_BarrenWorld]Barren[/HS] world and 2 small worlds.

StringTable.Label: KrysethSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The Krynn home system. It contains a class 26 [HS=HS_TerrestrialWorld]Terrestrial[/HS] world, and 2 small worlds with good resources.

StringTable.Label: IconisSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The new home system of the Iconian race, containing a class 25 [HS=HS_TerrestrialWorld]Terrestrial[/HS] world and a single small world.

StringTable.Label: MinorSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: Randomized home system for Minor Races. It contains a class 14 world.

StringTable.Label: DeadSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: A ruined star system. No Habitable Planets, just a burned out Rock. Used by the brave and adventuresome.

StringTable.Label: ArceaSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Arcean Empire, containing a class 28 [HS=HS_TerrestrialWorld]Terrestrial[/HS] world and a class 12 [HS=HS_DesertWorld]Desert[/HS] world.

StringTable.Label: System_Baratak_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Baratak contains a single class 32 [HS=HS_ArborealWorld]Arboreal[/HS] world.

StringTable.Label: System_Festron_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Festron contains a class 20 [HS=HS_JungleWorld]Jungle[/HS] world and 2 small worlds.[BR][BR]Not recommended for non-[HS=HS_Aquatic]Aquatic[/HS] civilizations.

StringTable.Label: System_Manti_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Manti contains a class 29 [HS=HS_AquaticWorld]Oceanic[/HS] world and 2 small worlds.[BR][BR]Not recommended for non-[HS=HS_Aquatic]Aquatic[/HS] civilizations.

StringTable.Label: TorusSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Torian Regime, containing a class 25 [HS=HS_AquaticWorld]Oceanic[/HS] world and 2 small worlds with good resources.[BR][BR]Not recommended for non-[HS=HS_Aquatic]Aquatic[/HS] races.

StringTable.Label: OnyxSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Onyx, an Asteroid-heavy system, containing a class 26 [HS=HS_MountainousWorld]Mountainous[/HS] world and a single small world.

StringTable.Label: GraveyardSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: A dead system of the Navigators contains a single class 32 [HS=HS_BombardedWorld]Bombarded[/HS] world.

StringTable.Label: MimotSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The Mimot home system. It contains a class 25 [HS=HS_TropicalWorld]Tropical[/HS] world and 3 small worlds.

StringTable.Label: XeloxiSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Xeloxi. It contains a single class 25 [HS=HS_DesertWorld]Desert[/HS] world and 2 small worlds.

StringTable.Label: ProximaCentauriSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the exiled Terran Resistance. It contains a class 28 [HS=HS_MountainousWorld]Mountainous[/HS] world and a single small world.

StringTable.Label: DrathaSystem_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Drath. It contains a class 28 [HS=HS_JungleWorld]Jungle[/HS] world and 2 small worlds.

StringTable.Label: System_Crystalline_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Crystalline contains a single class 30 [HS=HS_MountainousWorld]Mountainous[/HS] world and some Thulium deposits.

StringTable.Label: System_Korath_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Korath.

StringTable.Label: System_Absolute_Dec
StringTable.String: The home solar system of the Absolute features a class 24 radiated home world and 3 radiated small worlds.

StringTable.Label: System_Seeing_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Seeing has one perfect class 30 homeworld.

StringTable.Label: System_Moth_Dec
StringTable.String: The home system of the Phalenoids features one class 30 homeworld, two small worlds, and four dead planets.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_HitPointsCap
StringTable.String: Maximum Hitpoints our ships can have

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Intimidation
StringTable.String: Intimidation is used to manipulate others into doing what you want out of fear. It can be used against other civilizations to improve trade deals, as well as to force events to go your way. It is a powerful tool, but when it fails the targets won't be quick to forget what you tried to do.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Persuasion
StringTable.String: Persuasion is an ability we can use while trading with other civilizations. It increases the perceived value of our trade.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_RandomTechSlots
StringTable.String: Controls the number of available technologies than can be selected for research.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Approval
StringTable.String: Approval is a measure of how your citizens view your government. It can be affected by your [HS=HS_Taxes]Tax Rate[/HS], [HS=HS_Ideology]Ideology[/HS], [HS=HS_Crime]Crime[/HS], and much more. Different species have different motivations so check out your citizens to see what is liked and disliked.[BR][BR]Your planet's Approval is the average Approval of all of the citizens on that planet.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_FundedProduction
StringTable.String: Maximum production available when you are fully funded.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_FundedResearch
StringTable.String: Maximum production available when you are fully funded.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Military
StringTable.String: This is how much production a world contributes to the local Shipyard.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Research
StringTable.String: The higher your Research, the faster you learn new technologies. Research is provided by your world's [HS=HS_NaturalResources]Natural Resources[/HS] and boosted by research improvements and scientists.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_EmporiumFavor
StringTable.String: The Endless Emporium is faction that controls intergalactic trade.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_NaturalLeagueFavor
StringTable.String: The Natural League is a growing movement that rejects cybernetics and synthetic life of all types.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_WarforgedFavor
StringTable.String: The Warforged is a growing movement that believes that only the strong survive.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ProductionPoints
StringTable.String: Your planet's Raw Production is used to power Manufacturing, Research, and Wealth.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_InfluencePerTurn
StringTable.String: Your planet's Cultural output defines Influence on the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ColonyGrossIncome
StringTable.String: The number of Credits your worlds generate. The proportion that goes into your treasury is based on your Tax Rate.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Mining
StringTable.String: The total number of resources collected from strategic resources gathered by your starbases per month.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ColonyTaxRevenue
StringTable.String: Income gathered from this world is affected by both the Wealth of the world, and the Tax Rate you have set.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Influence
StringTable.String: Influence controls the spread of your civilization's borders. With a high enough Influence, you can overwhelm another civilization's borders and even flip their worlds to your control.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Growth
StringTable.String: Once enough Growth is generated on your world, a new citizen is created. Pollution will reduce the Growth of a world, while Fertility Clinics and other population improvements can increase it.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Tourism
StringTable.String: Half of your Tourism gets applied to your [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS] and half to your [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Tourism_Supernova
StringTable.String: Tourism increases how much [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS] you gain, based on how large your Zone of Control is.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_TourismIncome
StringTable.String: Tourism Income gets applied to your [HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS].

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Food
StringTable.String: Planets produce food that is consumed by your citizens. To get more, colonize new worlds, or specialize your citizens into Farmers.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Population
StringTable.String: The number of citizens that live on your world.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_PopulationCap
StringTable.String: This represents the maximum number of citizens that can live on this world.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_PlanetaryDefense
StringTable.String: Planetary defense improvements help to stop invading forces long before they ever reach the surface of your colony.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ResistanceBonus
StringTable.String: Resistance will help your population defend itself when invaded, and make it less susceptible to foreign influences.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_PlanetaryDefensesHP
StringTable.String: The amount of damage that your colony can take before being defenseless during an invasion.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_PlanetaryDefensesMaxHP
StringTable.String: The amount of damage that your colony can take before being defenseless during an invasion.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_PlanetaryDefensesRepairAbility
StringTable.String: The percentage of your max planetary defense hit points you can regain each week.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_TotalShipAttack
StringTable.String: Damage a sieging ship can do to a besieged planet.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_TradeLicensesMax
StringTable.String: Trade Licenses are required to establish Trade Routes with other worlds.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Diplomacy
StringTable.String: Diplomacy Bonus is a modifier on your relations with other civilizations. A higher Diplomacy will make them more likely to trade with you and to offer you treaties, while less likely to declare war on you. Each civilization leader has their own personality, and will evaluate their relationship with you differently.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_DiplomaticCapital
StringTable.String: Diplomatic Capital is a currency that can be used with other factions during Trading.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_DiplomaticCapitalCost
StringTable.String: Diplomatic Capital is a currency that can be used with other factions during Trading.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_DiplomaticCapitalIncome
StringTable.String: Diplomatic Capital is a currency that can be used with other factions during Trading.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_HitPoints
StringTable.String: The amount of damage a ship can take before it is destroyed.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_SensorRange
StringTable.String: Determines from how far away this object can see other objects like anomalies and enemy ships.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Logistics
StringTable.String: Logistics determines how many ships can operate together in a fleet. Every ship has a Logistics cost, and every player has a Logistics value. Generally, larger ships cost more Logistics then smaller ships.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_MovesCap
StringTable.String: Maximum distance your ships can move in a single turn.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_SiegeAbility
StringTable.String: A measure of a ship's ability to subdue an enemy planet.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Level
StringTable.String: The benefits of an improvement advance alongisde the level. Placing an improvement type on its ideal terrain, or placing it adjacent to other improvements that support it, will improve its level.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Maintenance
StringTable.String: The cost of maintaining structures and other elements of core worlds and colonies.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ManufacturingCost
StringTable.String: This is how much Manufacturing it takes to construct.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_Manufacturing
StringTable.String: The higher your Manufacturing, the faster you will be able to build improvements on planets and ships in your shipyards.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ManufacturingOverflow
StringTable.String: Surplus production available to be used on the next project.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ShipRange
StringTable.String: Distance non-probe ships can travel away from our planets and starbases.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Soldiering
StringTable.String: Reduces the time it takes to invade worlds.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Wealth
StringTable.String: Wealth is a measure of a planet's rare and valuable resources.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ModifierValue
StringTable.String: Increases the rate of benefit we receive from Precursor relics.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_LeaderMaxRecruits
StringTable.String: Modifies the number of leaders from which we can recruit.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_LeaderCostModify
StringTable.String: Modifies the cost to recruit new leaders.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_SecurityLevel
StringTable.String: Counter intelligence Spies are dedicated to protecting us from threats, both domestic and alien, who wish to steal our technologies. Leaders can be temporarily assigned in the Govern screen to increase our vigilance.[BR][BR]Assign more citizens to Counter Intelligence, to slow down or prevent foreign spies from stealing our technology.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_Population
StringTable.String: How much your population grows per month.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_ColonyNetIncome
StringTable.String: How many galactic credits your colonies are generating each turn. A percentage of this goes into your treasury based on your Tax Rate.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_ShipRangeUnderride
StringTable.String: Matches the range of the fleet it is in.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_MovesCapUnderride
StringTable.String: Matches the speed of the fleet it is in.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_TriggerAndNoShipBattle
StringTable.String: Will trigger an effect instead of battling when attacking.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_Administration
StringTable.String: Administrators are required for making constructors, colony ships, and survey ships. Specialize your citizens into Administrators to gain more Administration.

StringTable.Label: STATDESCRIPTION_PoliticalCapital
StringTable.String: Political Capital can be used in trade, or to convince other players to vote for you in the United Planets.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_LegionsAvailable
StringTable.String: Legions available to invade planets, or to defend your own planet with a General

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Minerals
StringTable.String: Minerals are a measure of a planet's raw mineral resources available to be directly applied to constructing improvements and ships.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Technology
StringTable.String: Technology is a rare natural resource that reflects the unusual and most interesting aspects of a planet. Scientists can study these to forward our research.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Fertility
StringTable.String: Fertility represents the amount of biological life the planet supports. This is critical for generating enough food to feed our citizens.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_PlanetInfluence
StringTable.String: Cultural Significance represents a planet's potential to generate influence, expanding your borders.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ColonySponsorDecayMod
StringTable.String: Percentage of resource output lost due to inefficiencies on the way to the sponsored core world.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_CanAssassinateDiplomats
StringTable.String: Allows you to assassinate diplomats assigned to you.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Crime
StringTable.String: Crime reduces the Income of your colony, as well as making it more likely to produce new citizens as criminals, which in turn raise Crime. Citizens will also suffer an Approval penalty if Crime is too high.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Pollution
StringTable.String: Quality of the environment on the planet. High Pollution reduces the Growth of citizens and the production of Food.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Control
StringTable.String: Your ability to force immediate effects, such as protest suppression, construction rushing, and executive orders. Generate Control through events, ideology traits, and special improvements.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_MaxEnactedPolicies
StringTable.String: Hard limit on the number of policies that you can enact at once.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Intelligence
StringTable.String: Intelligence modifies [HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] and related tasks. For leaders, Intelligence is important for a Minister of Technology and for [HS=HS_Governor]Governors[/HS] of technology-focused worlds.[BR][BR]For citizens, Intelligence is important for scientists.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Social
StringTable.String: Social modifies a leader's skill at [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] and [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS] tasks. A high Social skill is important for diplomats, Ministers of Colonization, and [HS=HS_Governor]Governors[/HS].[BR][BR]For citizens, Social is important for entertainers and traders.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Diligence
StringTable.String: Diligence modifies a leader's skill at production related tasks. A high Diligence is important for [HS=HS_Commander]Commanders[/HS] and for [HS=HS_Governor]Governors[/HS] of [HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS]-based worlds.[BR][BR]For citizens, Diligence is important for workers and farmers

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Resolve
StringTable.String: Resolve modifies a leader's skill at military tasks. A high Resolve makes for a powerful [HS=HS_Commander]Commander[/HS].[BR][BR]For citizens, Resolve is important for Soldiers. All of the Resolve from a world's citizens adds to that planet's [HS=HS_Resistance]Resistance[/HS]

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Expectations
StringTable.String: Expectations modify the [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] of a citizen. Citizens with high Expectations will need entertainment and luxury resources, while those with low Expectations are much easier to keep happy.[BR][BR]Specializing a unit will increase its Expectations.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_Loyalty
StringTable.String: Loyalty is a leader's opinion of you.[BR][BR]A leader with a Loyalty below 30 is at risk of resigning, or attempting to undermine you. A leader with an extremely high loyalty may offer additional support and help.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ApprovalFromSoldierUnits
StringTable.String: Approval provided by citizens assigned to be Soldiers.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostTotalitarianism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Totalitarianism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostIndividualism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Individualism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostTraditionalism
StringTable.String: Traditionalism Points cost for next Tradition Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostProgressivism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Progressivism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostPacifism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Pacifism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostCollectivism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Collectivism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitCostNihilism
StringTable.String: Culture Points cost for next Nihilism Cultural Trait

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceTotalitarianism
StringTable.String: Count of Totalitarianism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceTraditionalism
StringTable.String: Count of Traditionalism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceProgressivism
StringTable.String: Count of Progressivism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoicePacifism
StringTable.String: Count of Pacifism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceEgalitarianism
StringTable.String: Count of Egalitarianism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceCollectivism
StringTable.String: Count of Collectivism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceIndividualism
StringTable.String: Count of Individualism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IdeologyTraitChoiceNihilism
StringTable.String: Count of Nihilism choice on events

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_IgnoreRushLimit
StringTable.String: Let the player rush as many projects as they can afford.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_RushCosts
StringTable.String: A bonus modifier to the cost of rushing a project.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ApprovalFromClericUnits
StringTable.String: Approval provided by Clerics on your planets.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_ApprovalFromScientistUnits
StringTable.String: Approval bonus from having Scientists on a colony.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_AOERange
StringTable.String: Radius of area when area-of-effect modifiers are applied on the map.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Prestige
StringTable.String: Measure of progress towards galactic domination.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ThinktankFavor
StringTable.String: Improved thinktank favor results in better bonuses for you from the assigned leaders.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_BazaarDiscount
StringTable.String: Discount when buying at the Galactic Bazaar.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_CanIgnoreAtWarWithHomeworld
StringTable.String: Citizens of planets you have conquered no longer give an approval hit if you are war with their species.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_IntimidationBonus
StringTable.String: Increases the effectiveness of your intimidation tactics.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_CanIgnoreDiploPenaltyAtWarWithFriend
StringTable.String: Other civilizations ignore when you are at war with their friends.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_CanIgnoreDiploPenaltyTradingWithEnemy
StringTable.String: Other civilizations ignore when you are trading with their enemy.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_TechRandomOfferDiscountBonus
StringTable.String: An additional boost to the research discount offered on random techs.

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_TotalAttack
StringTable.String: Total attack power across all weapon types

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_TotalDefense
StringTable.String: Total defense power across all defense types

StringTable.Label: STATDEC_Conquest
StringTable.String: Measure of a fleet's effectiveness at laying siege on an enemy planet

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_BazaarPremium
StringTable.String: Premium when selling at the Galactic Bazaar.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_ThinktankPremium
StringTable.String: Bonus to the benefits of Thinktanks.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_CanIgnoreThinktankPenalties
StringTable.String: Ignore the negative effects of Thinktanks.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_IsAtWar
StringTable.String: Is player at war with anyone?

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_IsAtPeace
StringTable.String: Is player at peace with everyone?

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_GovernorColonyStatsPremium
StringTable.String: Boost to the Colony Stats affected by a Governor.

StringTable.Label: STATDESC_BattleRating
StringTable.String: Combination of weapon power, fire rates, ranges, defense capabilities, and hit point capacity, indicating general battle effectiveness.

StringTable.Label: TestRandomCoreWorldEvent_Name
StringTable.String: Debug: Test Random Core World Event

StringTable.Label: TestCitizenEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: Bloop blop beep. What would you like?

StringTable.Label: TestCitizenEvent_1_Bonus_Dec
StringTable.String: Yor Solider, Korath Engineer, Torian Scientist

StringTable.Label: TestCitizenEvent_2_Bonus_Dec
StringTable.String: Human Governor, Diplomat Snathi and Yor Leader.

StringTable.Label: TestDiplomacyEvent_Dec
StringTable.String: We found a wandering citizen of the {PLAYERFACTION:1}, and they are looking at us expectantly. How should we treat them?

StringTable.Label: TestEvent_Popup_Dec
StringTable.String: You recruited someone, good job. They make your planet pop grow now too.

StringTable.Label: TestEvent_Spawn_SubFaction_Choice_1_Dec
StringTable.String: Spins off a subfaction of your civilization

StringTable.Label: TEST_SPAWN_SUB_FACTION_LEADER_DESC
StringTable.String: A man of the people, sworn to keep his people free.

StringTable.Label: TestEvent_SpawnFaction_Dec
StringTable.String: Look for a new faction that has spawned near you.

StringTable.Label: TestEvent_GovernorLoyalty_Dec
StringTable.String: {GOVERNORNAME}, governor of {PLANETNAME}, is widely believed to be favoring personal friends at the expense of their world's citizens.[BR][BR]Our advisors have investigated the accusations and determined that they are false, and {GOVERNORNAME} hasn't done anything wrong.[BR][BR]Still, there is a loud public outcry for us to at least chastise the governor in some manner, or we will seem to be complicit in the supposed corruption.

StringTable.Label: TestEvent_GovernorLoyalty_Choice_Support_Name
StringTable.String: The governor has done nothing wrong and we will support them.

StringTable.Label: TestEvent_GovernorLoyalty_Choice_Condemn_Name
StringTable.String: Condemn the governor. That's the price of politics.

StringTable.Label: TheOpportunity_CampaignDec
StringTable.String: The year is 2307. The Drengin Empire once dominated this part of the galaxy. All other races served as slaves. The Empire was destined to last forever. But then, the diplomats of Sol III organized a rebellion and overturned Drengin dominance.[BR][BR]The once glorious Drengin Empire was reduced to a single star system. The home system remained untouched. The humans and their allies will not keep the Empire suppressed![BR][BR]Space is quite vast. In the Utha sector, worlds are untouched—a fresh start. However, It's not entirely isolated. Subspace traffic indicates something else is in this sector. Seek it out and conquer it!

StringTable.Label: Campaign_TheOpportunity_FindSignal_Dec
StringTable.String: The Empire deemed this sector secluded enough to begin expansion anew. Yet recent subspace signals indicate the sector isn't as isolated as expected. No matter what it is, find the signal's source and stomp it out.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_TheOpportunity_ConquerTargetHomeworld_Dec
StringTable.String: The Navigators are weak, exposed, and alone. Take their homeworld. It will send a message to their colonies that the Drengin Empire reigns here. They will submit, whether willingly or by force.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_TheOpportunity_ScanConqueredHomeworld_Dec
StringTable.String: The Navigators think they can hide things from the Drengin Empire. They are wrong. Scanning the recently conquered planet will expose whatever the Navigators don't want to be found.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DRENGIN_Campaign_TheOpportunity_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The humans and their allies believe they have successfully suppressed the Drengin Empire. They will be proven wrong. The Empire needs resources to return to dominance and subjugate all those inferior species.[BR][BR]So expansion begins here in Utha, an untouched sector of the universe. We are not alone as initially thought. Subspace traffic indicates something else is in the system. It, whatever it may be, can not be allowed to stand in the Empire's way. Seek it out, conquer it.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_DRENGIN_Campaign_TheOpportunity_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: There are none more vicious than the Drengin Empire. Borders expand quickly and gathered resources rapidly funneled into the military. Claiming planets and building a fleet will ensure nothing can resist Drengin subjugation.

StringTable.Label: Drengin_TheOpportunity_System_Dec
StringTable.String: The Utha System has a Class 32 planet and several smaller planets making it the perfect place to start expanding the Empire's borders.

StringTable.Label: Navigators_TheOpportunity_System_Dec
StringTable.String: The Minos system has a Class 32 planet where the Navigators crashed, allowing them to establish a colony and survive.

StringTable.Label: Project_TheOpportunity_ScanPlanet_ShortDec
StringTable.String: We can scan our planet for the object the Navigators hid.

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_Emporium_Desc
StringTable.String: The faction that runs the Galactic Bazaar. Dedicated to the free exchange of goods regardless of borders or treaties.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Bazaar]Galactic Bazaar[/HS] discount based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS] bonus based on the members' [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_EmpathySociety_Desc
StringTable.String: A community dedicated to building a kinder and more thoughtful universe.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] decrease based on the members' [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_ScienceGuild_Desc
StringTable.String: A group dedicated to the research of new things while avoiding larger, bulkier members of their species.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] decrease based on the members' [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_ConversionCore_Desc
StringTable.String: Dedicated to inventing new ways to research and persuade the gullible masses.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_ColonyGrossIncome]Income[/HS] decrease based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_ProductionCore_Desc
StringTable.String: A group dedicated to the maximizing production no matter the cost.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] decrease based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_MediaAlliance_Desc
StringTable.String: Here to share our cultural values with the rest of the universe, whether they want it or not.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_Diplomacy]Diplomacy[/HS] penalty based on the members' [HS=HS_Resolve]Resolve[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_SpacingGuild_Desc
StringTable.String: Secret society of beings seeking to fold space in new ways.[BR][BR]Moves increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS] penalty based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_SlaversGuild_Desc
StringTable.String: The greatest slave masters in the universe.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Manufacturing]Manufacturing[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS].[BR]Maintenance decrease based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_SuperiorityLeague_Desc
StringTable.String: Culls the weak to allow the strong to thrive.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS] penalty based on the members' [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_CapitalistSociety_Desc
StringTable.String: Working to privatize everything. Everything. Even what you're thinking right now.

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_Ecologism_Desc
StringTable.String: Working together to improve the ecology of our worlds.

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_Thrive_Desc
StringTable.String: A deeply spiritual group focused on the here-and-now at the expense of material things.

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_BankingClan_Desc
StringTable.String: Underwriting everything in the universe to the resentment of all.

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_MiningGuild_Desc
StringTable.String: Organization of people who mine the strategic resources for us.[BR][BR]Mining bonus based on the members' [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] decrease based on the members' [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_WarriorCaste_Desc
StringTable.String: The secret organization of our greatest warriors.

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_Singularity_Desc
StringTable.String: Seeks the technological singularity.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Research]Research[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].[BR]Maintenance based on the members' [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_NaturalLeague_Desc
StringTable.String: Concerned about the incorporation of cybernetics with the natural state of the species. Supports biological growth and diversity, but requires significant resources to do it.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS] decrease based on the members' [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_FreemindCenter_Desc
StringTable.String: Wants peace and balance in the galaxy.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Tourism]Tourism[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_ShipRange]Ship Range[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Resolve]Resolve[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_Warforged_Desc
StringTable.String: Prepared for war, even if they need to ignore government regulations to do it.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Military]Military[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Resolve]Resolve[/HS].[BR][HS=HS_Crime]Crime[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_Precursors_Desc
StringTable.String: Devoted to the study of the Precursors.[BR][BR]Relic bonus based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].[BR]Maintenance increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_ShimmeringDepths_Desc
StringTable.String: Protectors of the depths from which we came

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_ChurchOfTheWay_Desc
StringTable.String: Adopting all into our church.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] and [HS=HS_Influence]Influence[/HS] increase based on the members' [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Thinktank_CuttersGuild_Desc
StringTable.String: A collection of the most powerful criminal organizations

StringTable.Label: Tutorial1_Description
StringTable.String: Learn basic ship movement and map navigation, to lead your fleets to victory!

StringTable.Label: Tutorial2_Description
StringTable.String: Learn how to colonize new worlds.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial3_Description
StringTable.String: One you have a new world, learn how to improve it.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial4_Description
StringTable.String: One ship can't conquer the galaxy alone. To wage real wars you will need fleets.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial5_Description
StringTable.String: Your leaders can be used for various roles. Learn how to use them to fill minister positions that apply civilization-wide bonuses.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial6_Description
StringTable.String: Careful focus on research and your economy is as important as war. Learn how to advance your civilization.

StringTable.Label: Tutorial_CampaignDec
StringTable.String: In 2178, the humans of a United Earth developed Hyperdrive Propulsion systems, discovering faster-than-light travel.[BR][BR]Humanity had already established interstellar contact with two civilizations: The Korx and the Arcean Empire. Some scientists, eager to share their discoveries, transmit the specifications for the new drive systems to the Arceans and the Korx. Both groups go silent immediately after receiving the specifications for this new technology. Earth is left alone in the universe once again.[BR][BR]You are Commander DL Bradley, leader of the newly formed Terran Alliance. This group has been created to oversee the manned exploration of space and the colonization of new planets. Humanity's new Hyperdrive Propulsion makes such grand ambitions possible.[BR][BR]Unfortunately, you must contend with a new threat: Pirates. A group of terrorists have acquired the Hyperdrive plans. They threaten all colonization efforts as long as they keep a foothold in nearby star systems. At some point, we will need to find and destroy their base.[BR][BR]Your primary mission is to colonize at least 8 worlds with at least one large enough to warrant a governor and establish leaders to support the effort.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_ColonizeTargetPlanets_Dec
StringTable.String: Explore the galaxy to find planets to colonize. Planets can be colonized using Colony Ships. Colony Ships can be constructed at a Shipyard or obtained through the Draft Colonists Executive Order.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_FillCabinet_Dec
StringTable.String: Grant benefits to the entire Alliance by recruiting Leaders and putting them to work. Recruited Leaders can be assigned roles in the Ministry, accessible through the Leader Screen. Each position provides a unique benefit based on a specific stat, so pick the best person for the job to get the best benefit possible.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_AppointGovernor_Dec
StringTable.String: Planets with a Planet Class 10 or greater can be turned into Coreworlds by assigning a Governor to the planet. To assign a Governor, you'll first need a Leader available. Planets with Governors can be upgraded to improve output and support a new Shipyard.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_DestroyTheShipyard_Dec
StringTable.String: Pirates have set up a base in this part of the galaxy. While they're allowed a Shipyard, they can produce ships that threaten the whole Alliance. Destroying the Pirate's Shipyard will weaken their forces and drive them from the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_Overall
StringTable.String: Secure the Sector for the Terran Alliance

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_FindCoreWorld_Dec
StringTable.String: You've successfully colonized enough planets for the Alliance; however, the Alliance wants to enhance its foothold with a new Coreworld. To establish a new Coreworld, you'll need a Colony on a planet with a Planet Class 10 or higher. Continue to search the galaxy for a planet at Planet Class 10 or greater to colonize.

StringTable.Label: Campaign_Tutorail_UnlockLeaders_Dec
StringTable.String: There are a lot of benefits that Leaders provide to the entire civilization. The project Colonial Leadership needs to be completed at the homeworld to recruit and manage Leaders. The project can be queued up and completed through the planet management screen from the Projects section.

StringTable.Label: Event_Campaign_Tutorial_Intro_Dec
StringTable.String: In 2178, the humans of a United Earth developed Hyperdrive Propulsion systems, discovering faster-than-light travel.[BR][BR]Humanity had already established interstellar contact with two civilizations: The Korx and the Arcean Empire. Some scientists, eager to share their discoveries, transmit the specifications for the new drive systems to the Arceans and the Korx. Both groups go silent immediately after receiving the specifications for this new technology. Earth is left alone in the universe once again.[BR][BR]You are Commander DL Bradley, leader of the newly formed Terran Alliance. This group has been created to oversee the manned exploration of space and the colonization of new planets. Humanity's new Hyperdrive Propulsion makes such grand ambitions possible.[BR][BR]Unfortunately, you must contend with a new threat: Pirates. A group of terrorists have acquired the Hyperdrive plans. They threaten all colonization efforts as long as they keep a foothold in nearby star systems. At some point, we will need to find and destroy their base.[BR][BR]Your primary mission is to colonize at least 8 worlds with at least one large enough to warrant a governor and establish leaders to support the effort.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_Campaign_Tutorial_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Terran Alliance has been formed by United Earth to explore space and colonize new planets. This project has been made possible by the development of faster-than-light travel. Approaching the galaxy warrants caution. If the natural dangers of the cosmos weren't enough, there might be aliens. [BR][BR]It's been some time since humanity last contacted the Arceans or the Korx, leaving them alone in the galaxy once more. It may only be a matter of time before discovering other alien groups. Until then, it's up to the Terran Alliance and its commander, DL Bradley, to secure the sector in the name of humanity.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_Campaign_Tutorial_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Terran Alliance's current isolation should be considered an advantage. There is an opportunity to expand, establish production, and discover how best to organize.

StringTable.Label: MinisterExploration_Dec
StringTable.String: Minister of Exploration[BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHot]Manages our travel to the edge of the galaxy.[/COLOR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Increases our Moves and Range based on the Diligence of the assigned Minister[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: MinisterTechnology_Dec
StringTable.String: Minister of Technology[BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHot]Manages the research across our empire.[/COLOR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Adds an additional Technology Slot and increases Research based on the Intelligence of the assigned Minister[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: MinisterDefense_Dec
StringTable.String: Minister of Defense[BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHot]Makes sure our fleet and colonies are secure.[/COLOR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Increases ship Hit Points and Resistance based on the Resolve of the assigned Minister[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: MinisterCulture_Dec
StringTable.String: Minister of Culture[BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHot]Spreading our influence throughout the galaxy.[/COLOR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Increases Influence based on the Social of the assigned Minister[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: MinisterFinance_Dec
StringTable.String: Minister of Finance[BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHot]Provides access to new trade opportunities.[/COLOR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Reduces Maintenance based on the Intelligence of the assigned Minister[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: MinisterProduction_Dec
StringTable.String: Minister of Production[BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHot]Improves production across our empire.[/COLOR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Increases Manufacturing based on the Diligence of the assigned Minister[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: MinisterBiology_Dec
StringTable.String: Minister of Health[BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHot]Focuses on the health of our citizens.[/COLOR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Increases Growth based on the Diligence skill of the assigned Minister[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: MinisterColony_Dec
StringTable.String: Minister of Colonization[BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHot]By listening to the needs of citizens on all out worlds we can improve their Approval.[/COLOR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Increases Approval on all Core Worlds except our Homeworld based on the Social skill of the assigned Minister[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: MinisterTourism_Dec
StringTable.String: Minister of Tourism[BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHot]If we can draw travelers to our worlds they will enhance them, and our economy.[/COLOR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Increases the [HS=HS_Tourism]Tourism[/HS] of our worlds based on the Social of the assigned Minister[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: MinisterCrime_Dec
StringTable.String: Minister of Justice[BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHot]The security of our citizens, and their possessions, is a primary responsibility of a government.[/COLOR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Reduces the Crime on your colonies based on the Diligence of the assigned Minister[/COLOR]

StringTable.Label: Race_Altarian_Dec
StringTable.String: Most Altarians adopt a Mer, a philosophy they devote their life to. This makes them more ideological than other species and more approving when their [HS=HS_Ideology]Ideology[/HS] matches that of their empire or governor, and more disapproving when it is opposed to them. They can also be specialized to [HS=HS_DivineEmpath]Divine Empaths[/HS], though it is an expensive process.

StringTable.Label: Race_Arcean_Dec
StringTable.String: Arcean's stoic nature makes them unlikely to be [HS=HS_Ideology]ideological[/HS]. Instead they revere the military and Arcean soldiers gain additional [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] and are never pacifists.

StringTable.Label: Race_Baratak_Dec
StringTable.String: The Baratak are stout citizens who require very little to be content. But they are sensitive to [HS=HS_Pollution]Pollution[/HS] and won't be happy, or healthy, on heavily polluted worlds.

StringTable.Label: Race_Drath_Dec
StringTable.String: The Drath are an ancient race that are fond of their legacy and their vast storehouses of credits. They receive an [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus based on the Credits in their treasury.

StringTable.Label: Race_Drengin_Dec
StringTable.String: Drengin have a high [HS=HS_Resistance]Resistance[/HS] and aptitude for becoming strong [HS=HS_Soldier]Soldiers[/HS]. Drengin have no [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] penalty for living on undefended worlds. They defend themselves.

StringTable.Label: Race_Festron_Dec
StringTable.String: Festron love Jungle worlds. They also occasionally murder other species they share a world with.

StringTable.Label: Race_Human_Dec
StringTable.String: Humans are known for their flexibility and productivity. They have lower [HS=HS_Expectations]Expectations[/HS] than other species.

StringTable.Label: Race_Iconian_Dec
StringTable.String: Iconians are a paranoid species that are still traumatized by their near extinction by the Yor. Because of this they suffer a significant [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] penalty if they share a world with them. And even though they are as temperamental as other species, their passive nature prevents them from protesting.

StringTable.Label: Race_Iridium_Dec
StringTable.String: Iridium's high Social make them excellent [HS=HS_Trader]Traders[/HS]. They receive an [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus based on the Credits in your treasury.

StringTable.Label: Race_Manti_Dec
StringTable.String: Manti love [HS=HS_Aquatic]Aquatic[/HS] worlds. They receive a large [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus when they are on them and a slight penalty when they aren't.

StringTable.Label: Race_Mimot_Dec
StringTable.String: An average race with an above average [HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS] rate. They will quickly overwhelm planets and consume all available [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Race_Navigators_Dec
StringTable.String: Navigator society is built around investigating the wonders of the universe, often to the exclusion of everything else. Their high [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] makes them the best scientists in the galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Race_Onyx_Dec
StringTable.String: The Onyx have no need for organic food and sustain themselves on the energy of the universe. [HS=HS_OnyxHiveGrowth]Onyx Hive Growth[/HS] rate is dependent on the amount of Promethion their civilization holds.

StringTable.Label: Race_Torian_Dec
StringTable.String: Torian love [HS=HS_Aquatic]Aquatic[/HS] worlds. They receive a large [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus when they are on them and a slight penalty when they aren't. But their subjugation by the Drengin makes them unhappy when they share worlds with Drengin citizens.

StringTable.Label: Race_Xeloxi_Dec
StringTable.String: Xeloxi have few redeeming qualities, if by few you mean none. Their culture rewards strong action and concerns like ethics or compassion were lost long ago. Every Xeloxi is a criminal and generates [HS=HS_Crime]Crime[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Race_Yor_Dec
StringTable.String: As a synthetic species Yor don't require [HS=HS_Food]Food[/HS] or have any natural [HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS]. Instead their citizens are manufactured.[BR][BR]They also don't suffer any [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] penalty from Pollution, Overcrowding or reaching their Population Capacity.

StringTable.Label: Race_Burran_Dec
StringTable.String: A peaceful species who believes that a series of 7 "rigors" will cause them to be elevated to a godlike existence. Each rigor takes many years to accomplish and only the first 3 of these can be performed on their home planet, afterwards they explore the universe pursuing their tasks.

StringTable.Label: Race_Orphica_Dec
StringTable.String: The Orphic Enclave serves only to expand the power of an ancient, renegade supercomputer.

StringTable.Label: Race_Klepart_Dec
StringTable.String: The first united technical achievement of their species was the creation of a great beacon tower to send their call out into space. A few days after turning it on an answer was received, a fleet of warships appeared in orbit above their world and raiders were sent down to collect every child on their homeworld. And then the raiders were gone. An entire generation of the Klepart was lost. The next generation has now grown old enough to begin exploring space on their own, but they remain fearful that the raiders will return, and hopeful that they will someday find the children that were stolen from them.

StringTable.Label: Race_Kaxx_Dec
StringTable.String: They believe their home world is the cocoon for a sleeping creature and they were placed on the planet to guard her. One day they believe the creature will awake and either spread new life across the universe or kill everyone.

StringTable.Label: Race_Odair_Dec
StringTable.String: Extreme nihilists counting down the moments until the universe succumbs to the eventual pull of entropy. Believe the Krynn in particular are the most foolish (for their faith) but are hard pressed to be enthused about anyone. There is a black hole at the edge of their galaxy, "The Yawning Mouth of God" that they delight in sending elaborate constructions into.

StringTable.Label: Race_Lantern_Dec
StringTable.String: A young but promising race until early galactic traders introduced them to euphoric vapors that were enjoyed by other species but deeply addictive to the Lantern. Now the Lantern society is dominated by the search for additional sources of the drug and all citizens are kept on it at all times.

StringTable.Label: Race_Snathi_Dec
StringTable.String: Snathi are clever and resourceful, but very likely to be criminals.

StringTable.Label: Race_Trandal_Dec
StringTable.String: Easily distracted and always hungry Trandals are good at taking orders, and that's about it.

StringTable.Label: Race_Tywom_Dec
StringTable.String: The Tywom aren't very smart, and certainly aren't very socially adept. Their only positive quality is their incredibly low [HS=HS_Expectations]Expectations[/HS]. They are very accustomed to being treated poorly, and they are even happier when they share a world with other species. Though the other species may not like it.

StringTable.Label: Race_Korath_Dec
StringTable.String: If you thought the Drengin were disagreeable, the Korath are even worse. Though they have incredible [HS=HS_Resolve]Resolve[/HS] and [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS] but their social skills are lacking and they dislike sharing a world with any other species.

StringTable.Label: Race_Slyne_Dec
StringTable.String: The Slyne do not require organic food to survive, but their slow [HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS] rate hampers their ability to spread out into the galaxy as quickly as other species.

StringTable.Label: Race_Thalan_Dec
StringTable.String: The Thalan are from a dimension more advanced than ours. Their insight provides them with an increased [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] and also increased [HS=HS_Expectations]Expectations[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Race_Phamysht_Dec
StringTable.String: The Phamysht are a polite and engaging species, until they murder you. Still, their high [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS] and [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] makes up for their equally high [HS=HS_Expectations]Expectations[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Race_Scryve_Dec
StringTable.String: The Scryve are waning. Each of their citizens has incredibly high [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS], [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] and [HS=HS_Resolve]Resolve[/HS] but they are handicapped by their low [HS=HS_Growth]Growth[/HS] which will make it difficult to spread out among the stars unless they capture another species to do it.

StringTable.Label: Race_Crystalline_Dec
StringTable.String: Luxar have no need for organic food but their [HS=HS_OnyxHiveGrowth]Growth[/HS] is generally less than organic species. Their growth can be increased based on the amount of Promethion they have stored.[BR][BR]Despite their low growth rate their high [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS], [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] and [HS=HS_Resolve]Resolve[/HS] makes them well suited for nearly any task.

StringTable.Label: Race_Absolute_Dec
StringTable.String: Irradiated citizens evolve if given enough time, each evolution more capable than the last. At the starting Amoeba stage, they reproduce frequently and are quick to evolve but are poor workers.

StringTable.Label: Race_Absolute2_Dec
StringTable.String: Irradiated citizens evolve if given enough time, each evolution more capable than the last. At the Larva stage, their [HS=HS_Growth]Growth Rate[/HS] slows, but they are more skilled than their Amoeba forms.

StringTable.Label: Race_Absolute3_Dec
StringTable.String: Irradiated citizens evolve if given enough time, each evolution more capable than the last. At the final Nymph stage, their [HS=HS_Growth]Growth Rate[/HS] slows significantly, but they are highly skilled.

StringTable.Label: Race_Seeing_Dec
StringTable.String: The Intueri have high [HS=HS_Diligence]Diligence[/HS] and low [HS=HS_Expectations]Expectations[/HS]. They put the needs of the group over their own. Lacking true complex thought -expect low [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS].

StringTable.Label: Race_Moth_Dec
StringTable.String: Brilliant and sociable creatures, Phalenoids excel in [HS=HS_Intelligence]Intelligence[/HS] and [HS=HS_Social]Social[/HS], but they make poor soldiers. They prefer to befriend other species. Their [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] increases when sharing their world with other species.

StringTable.Label: Race_Feline_Dec
StringTable.String: Elegant and astute, Felinoids distinguish themselves with keen intellect and agile cunning. They prefer roles of strategic importance, thriving as scientists, diplomats, or spies, and display an affinity for complex systems. Highly individualistic, they can struggle with regimented military roles. Their curious natures make them adept cultural adapters, gaining an [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus when cohabiting worlds with other species.

StringTable.Label: Race_Canine_Dec
StringTable.String: Loyal and intuitive, Caninoids demonstrate exceptional teamwork and remarkable instincts. They naturally excel in roles requiring cooperation and protection, such as military or policing duties. While not typically drawn to independent intellectual pursuits, they're formidable tactical operators within a group dynamic. Their sociable temperament engenders strong bonds, earning them an [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] boost when sharing their world with other species. They have very low expectations.

StringTable.Label: Race_Avian_Dec
StringTable.String: Graceful and visionary, Avianoids are known for their strategic foresight and aerial mastery. They excel in roles requiring a broad perspective, such as scouts, diplomats, or strategic planners. Their nimble agility can be less effective in ground-based military engagements. With a natural inclination towards harmony, they gain an [HS=HS_Approval]Approval[/HS] bonus when coexisting with diverse species on their world.

StringTable.Label: Race_Minor_Dec
StringTable.String: A less advanced species that is unable to travel outside their solar system.

StringTable.Label: SoulOfMachine_CampaignDec
StringTable.String: Even in 2307, the Yor Singularity remains a powerful force in the Galaxy. Long have they strived to bring others into their collective consciousness -the Totatily. Though their programming compels them to continue to expand and convert organic to synthetic, they are far from alone among the stars.[BR][BR]The Singularity must make several critical decisions that will determine their efforts for decades. Who among the other Civilizations do they forge alliances with, and who do they destroy? Will their bitter conflict with their creators, the Iconian Refuge, ever end?

StringTable.Label: FACTION_YOR_SoulOfMachine_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Yor are artificial beings, originally servants of an ancient species known as the Iconians. Granted sentience by the Dread Lords, the Yor turned against their Iconian creators, apparently wiping them from the face of the galaxy. Whether due to some hidden command of the Dread Lords, or simply from applying the cold rules of logic, the Yor have since become viciously xenophobic, and now despise all biological lifeforms. Capable of long-term planning and a surprising degree of cunning, the Yor often speak and negotiate with organic beings. Those beings should understand that this is nothing but a short-term ploy, and that their new friends will never rest until they, and all other organic life, are destroyed.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_YOR_SoulOfMachine_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Yor are highly productive and capable of building large fleets of self-repairing vessels. They're profoundly unpopular, and few races opt to befriend them. Unlike organic races, their growth rate is a function of production capacity.

StringTable.Label: EverythingForSale_CampaignDec
StringTable.String: With so many different Civilizations in the Galaxy, 2307 could be a banner year for trade and commerce. Someone needs to facilitate all the various transactions and dealings, and the Corporate Sector is the most obvious fit for the role.[BR][BR]The Corporate Sector has a chance to secure a dominant position in the Galaxy through Influence and market control.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_IRIDIUM_EverythingForSale_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Corporate Sector is the apex corporate entity of an ultra-capitalistic society, the only organization capable of entering into contracts on behalf of the entire Iridium people. The Iridium culture is based on a firm, even fanatical belief in the power of free markets. Although no strangers to weaponry, all research is first considered through the lens of mutual cooperation; the destructive cost of warfare is often too great for Iridiums to seriously consider. It remains to be seen how well this philosophy will fare when introduced to more close-minded races.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_IRIDIUM_EverythingForSale_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Corporate Sector is excellent at research and development and quick to maximize the economic potential of any new discovery. They have many ways to fill up the treasury, and they are well-served to use them: their citizens are happiest when they are wealthy, and dislike being poor.

StringTable.Label: BraveNewUniverse_CampaignDec
StringTable.String: In 2317, Subspace Streaming allowed for travel to parts of the Galaxy previously uncharted by the Civilizations of the Orion Sector. In these distant systems are Civilizations capable of faster-than-light travel and have developed advanced technologies. Among them is the Luxar Dominion, a group of crystalline beings with plans for a vast array of arms.[BR][BR]Tensions rise With so many new players on the galactic stage. Is the Luxar Dominion open to forming alliances, or will they utilize their horrifying Terror Stars to wipe out entire systems?[BR][BR]The situation is delicate; one misstep could lead to an all-out war.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_Campaign_BraveNewUniverse_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: Through the use of Subspace Streaming, contact has been made with new Civilizations. Among them is the Luxar Dominion, who developed hyperdrive technology independently, as the Terran Alliance did. They seem prominent and powerful.[BR][BR]The Terran Alliance is now in a delicate situation. The Alliance's actions here can shape the relationship between the disparate Civilizations. A misstep here may lead to a devastating war.[BR][BR]The Terran Alliance must use its sway to keep the peace and form healthy relationships.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_TERRAN_Campaign_BraveNewUniverse_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: The Terran Alliance can use diplomacy and military might to influence the civilizations around them. Some conflict may be required, but it should be quelled and avoided whenever possible. Anything but an Influence Victory here threatens all life across the Galaxy.

StringTable.Label: Radioactive_CampaignDec
StringTable.String: 2317, the year the Orion sector contacts an entirely new part of the Galaxy. Among the Civilizations reached is the Cosmic Contaminant, a group of nearly incomprehensible lifeforms known as the Irradiated. The Luxar Dominion attempts to rally allies to help exterminate the Cosmic Contaminant.[BR][BR]The Cosmic Contaminant has not survived for millennia, where all other life decays, to be destroyed by those that can't adapt.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ABSOLUTE_Radioactive_StartupDescription
StringTable.String: The Irradiated developed on toxic and radioactive worlds. Where all others wither, they thrive. They are a threatening enigma that has devastated all others they've encountered. Over time, they have only become more effective at turning planets into polluted wastelands.[BR][BR]The Luxar Dominion, all too familiar with the Irradiated, is attempting to rally the newly contacted Civilizations of the Orion sector against what has been termed the Cosmic Contaminant. They can not be allowed to succeed.

StringTable.Label: FACTION_ABSOLUTE_Radioactive_StartupTraitsDescription
StringTable.String: Assume the Cosmic Contaminant will find no allies here. Treat all other Civilizations as hostile. Utilize all the various ways to pollute planets and render them uninhabitable to all but the Irradiated. A war of attrition benefits the Contaminant, who thrive on planets poisoned in the conflict and replenish numbers quickly.
